0.title: Kerala HC directs NHAI to fix potholes after death of a man
0.article_body: After a man died in Kochi, Kerala HC directed the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to fill the potholes immediately. This comes after a scooter rider died in an accident in Ernakulam due to a pothole on Friday. Kerala PWD Minister blamed contractors for the pothole-ridden National Highway.

1.title: 100 citizens walk with 75m flag to mark 75th Independence Day in B'luru
1.article_body: Residents of Bengaluru's HSR Layout walked with a 75-metre-long Indian flag on Sunday morning to mark India's 75th Independence Day. Over 100 participants, including children and senior citizens, walked almost three kilometres from Somasundarapalya Lake to Haralur Lake. The residents' group shared a video of the walkathon on Twitter as part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav campaign.

2.title: Social media firms need to enable voluntary user verification: Govt
2.article_body: Social media platforms are required to enable users to voluntarily verify their accounts, Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. The voluntarily verified users must also be provided with visible verification marks, he added. We're aware of the risk and danger posed by growing phenomenon of misinformation, bots, criminality and users' harm in general, he said.

3.title: Nigerian man wanted in drugs case found dead in Thane forest
3.article_body: A Nigerian man, wanted in connection with a drugs case, was found dead after a police chase in a forest in Thane city, an official from city police said on Sunday. The deceased had several cases of drug possession registered against him and his wife had also been arrested by the police in Mumbai, the official added.

4.title: Plan to check air pollution in Delhi-NCR to come into force on Oct 1
4.article_body: Anti-air pollution measures followed in Delhi and its neighbourhood according to the severity of situation will come into effect on October 1 this year, which is 15 days before the usual date. The revamped Graded Response Action Plan focuses on the implementation of restrictions based on forecasts. Among other restrictions, it recommends a ban on use of coal and firewood.

5.title: Excited to meet PM Modi: Para TT player Bhavina after CWG 2022 gold win
5.article_body: Para table tennis player Bhavina Patel said she's excited to meet PM Narendra Modi following her gold medal win at CWG 2022. Talking about her performance, Bhavina said, "I'm happy with my performance. The way I trained for this really showed in my game." On Saturday, Bhavina became the first-ever Indian to win gold in para table tennis at CWG.

6.title: Our girls are shining the brightest: Gambhir on Nitu's gold, women's hockey bronze
6.article_body: Reacting to boxer Nitu Ghanghas winning gold and the women's hockey team bagging bronze at the CWG 2022, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Our girls are shining the brightest!" Nitu won gold after defeating World Championships 2019 bronze medallist Demie-Jade Resztan of England in the final of over 45kg-48kg (minimumweight) category. Indian women's hockey team defeated New Zealand 2-1.

7.title: Institutions captured, democracy gasping for breath: P Chidambaram
7.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said that he is veering to the "painful conclusion" that the Parliament has become "dysfunctional". "Institutions have been tamed or emasculated or captured," Chidambaram added. "Democracy is gasping for breath. We may have the shell of democracy but inside, the shell has been hollowed out," the Congress leader stated.

8.title: Zomato rejects EY's lower share price valuation for Blinkit deal
8.article_body: Zomato has rejected revised valuation report by EY that lowered its share price for acquiring hyperlocal delivery company Blinkit for ₹4,447 crore. In a statement, Zomato said fair market value per equity share of the company would remain ₹70.76. In first valuation report, EY had priced Zomato at ₹70.76 per share. The new report was based on a different methodology.

9.title: 21% Keralites above 30 prone to serious diseases: Govt survey
9.article_body: Around 21% people were found to be prone to serious diseases after the Kerala Health Department screened 7 lakh people aged above 30 years for the prevalence of lifestyle diseases. State Health Minister Veena George said that 8,982 persons had been found at the risk of tuberculosis, 8,614 with uterine cancer, 47,549 with breast cancer, and 3,006 with colon cancer.

10.title: Three puppies die after getting stuck in borewell for 29 hrs in Punjab
10.article_body: Three puppies died after being stuck in a borewell for around 29 hours in Punjab's Kharar. National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and police teams had been called after the puppies had fallen into the borewell. According to reports, earthmovers and pipes to supply oxygen were used during the rescue operations but the puppies couldn't be saved.

11.title: For me, she's a Devi: Akshay Kumar on his bond with sister Alka Bhatia
11.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who'll soon be seen in Aanand L Rai's 'Raksha Bandhan', spoke about his bond with his sister Alka Bhatia. "Since childhood, my parents have taught me...my sister isn't just my sister but a Devi...For me, she's a Devi," he said. Akshay further said his sister doesn't fight at all and remains calm even if his temper rises sometimes.

12.title: Musical event on to celebrate Har Ghar Tiranga campaign in Delhi
12.article_body: Flag Foundation of India organised a musical event in Delhi's Connaught Place to celebrate the Centre's Har Ghar Tiranga campaign on August 6 and 7. Flag Foundation of India is a non-profit body founded by former MP Naveen Jindal to promote the National Flag. People were seen waving the flag in CP to mark 75 years of India's Independence.

13.title: IAEA chief raises concern over shelling at nuclear plant in Ukraine
13.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi has expressed concerns over shelling at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "The shelling...underlines the very real risk of a nuclear disaster," Grossi said. The Russian forces had captured the nuclear power plant in the initial days of the invasion, however, it is run by Ukrainian technicians.

14.title: US city dissolves its police department over officer's racist text
14.article_body: The city of Vincent in US' Alabama has dissolved its police department and fired its police chief and assistant police chief after a racist text allegedly sent by one of them surfaced on social media. The text made a reference to a "pregnant slave". "[The incident] has torn this community apart," Vincent councilman Corey Abrams said.

15.title: Man shares pic of paperwork for Schengen visa, Twitter users react
15.article_body: A Twitter user named Saptarshi Prakash applied for Schengen visa and wrote, "Applying for a tourist visa to one of the most developed countries...This is the amount of paper I'm supposed to carry to prove I've the money to stay there and come back." A Twitter user replied, "Nice pillow". Another user wrote, "This is ITR paperwork on steroids".

16.title: Affordable housing scheme proposed for Maha’s transgender community
16.article_body: The Social Welfare Department of the Maharashtra government has proposed an affordable housing scheme for the transgender community, a senior official confirmed. Under the proposed scheme, as many as 150 flats at a dedicated residential housing complex in Nagpur will be offered to them. "The beneficiaries will have to pay only 10% of the flat price," the official added.

17.title: Colombia's first leftist President Gustavo Petro takes office
17.article_body: Colombia's first leftist President, Gustavo Petro, has been sworn into office on Sunday. Petro, a former member of Colombia's M-19 guerrilla group, promised to fight inequality, reduce violence, bring economic reform and introduce free public university education. Petro, who won the presidential election in June against conservative parties, said he would like to work with US "as equals".

18.title: India create history, win both gold and silver in men's triple jump at CWG 2022
18.article_body: India today created history by winning both gold and silver medals in men's triple jump at CWG 2022. Eldhose Paul became the first-ever Indian to bag a gold medal in triple jump at CWG. The 25-year-old won with a best jump of 17.03 metres. Abdulla Aboobacker bagged silver to record India's first-ever one-two finish in men's triple jump at CWG.

19.title: Poonawalla criticises Rajasthan CM over his rape law remarks
19.article_body: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Rajasthan CM over his rape law remarks and asked Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi to respond on the issue. “Gehlot was blaming the rape laws, which were made stringent after Nirbhaya episode which took place under UPA, instead of blaming the rapists,” said Poonawalla. He further added that Congress is suffering from "blame game" mentality.

20.title: Maharashtra Cyber Department warns public of online frauds
20.article_body: The Maharashtra Cyber Department has asked people to be more vigilant against online frauds and scams. It also asked people not to respond to video calls, friend requests from people posing as police officers. "People need to be aware before applying for anything online. Fraudsters are posing as officers of Delhi cyber police to extort money," an official said.

21.title: Idgah govt property, doesn't belong to Wakf board: B'luru civic body
21.article_body: The Idgah ground in Bengaluru belongs to the Revenue Department of the Karnataka government and not the Wakf board, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has claimed. BBMP Joint Commissioner (west) SM Srinivasa said the Wakf board failed to claim the rights of the land. Wakf board chairman Shafi Saadi said they would fight against the revenue department.

22.title: Pics are under-exposed, not over-exposed: Twinkle on Ranveer's photoshoot
22.article_body: Actor-turned-writer Twinkle Khanna has reacted to Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot and the FIRs against it in her column. She said a "thumping majority of women and the queer community" weren't offended by it. "We have...one complaint. Instead of over-exposure, the photographs seem under-exposed," she added. She concluded that they're unable to spot any "anatomical details" even with zoom tools.

23.title: Ola Electric's month-on-month sales fall 42% in July: Report
23.article_body: Ola Electric sold 3,426 two-wheelers in July 2022, 42% less than the previous month when 5,874 units were sold, data from the Federation of Automobile Dealers Association (FADA) showed. The two-wheeler retail run witnessed poor demand amid high inflation, erratic monsoon and underperforming rural India, the FADA report said. It also raised concern over looming threat of semiconductor shortage.

24.title: Marriage should happen soon, everything is going right: Karan on Tejasswi
24.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra, speaking about his girlfriend Tejasswi Prakash, has said that they may soon get married. "Everything is going right. Everything is going wonderful...She's kind of endearing as a person. She is extremely different," Karan further stated. The duo featured in 'Bigg Boss 15', which Tejasswi went on to win.

25.title: Senior citizens, students to get concessions while travelling in NMMT buses
25.article_body: Senior citizens, differently-abled persons and students under 18 years of age residing under Panvel Municipal Corporation's (PMC) jurisdiction will get concessions while travelling in Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport's (NMMT) buses. Differently-abled persons will get 100% concession while senior citizens and students will get 50% concession. This benefit is already available for women.

26.title: Kejriwal promises round-the-clock power supply in Gujarat
26.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said his party will ensure a round-the-clock power supply in Gujarat if it wins the upcoming Assembly polls. "People in Gujarat are in misery. The bills are too high. Three months after making government in Gujarat, we'll make electricity free. We would…waive off bills from the previous year," Kejriwal added.

27.title: Man hires killer to kill 17-yr-old daughter over affair in UP, held
27.article_body: A man hired a ward boy to kill his 17-year-old daughter for not severing ties with her lover in UP, police said. Posing as a doctor, the ward boy injected a high dose of potassium chloride into the 17-year-old girl, police said. The ward boy confessed to the police and revealed that he had received ₹1 lakh from the father.

28.title: BBMP to offer tuitions for poor kids from August 15 onwards
28.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will launch a new project under which it'll provide tuitions to poor children studying in third and fifth standards from August 15 onwards. The project will be launched at various places across Bengaluru on a pilot basis under the 'Vidyarthi Belaku Adhyayana Kendra' scheme. The tuition timings will be between 5:30 pm and 7:00 pm.

29.title: Hooda is strong contender for T20 WC squad, saying this as ex-chief selector: Srikkanth
29.article_body: Ex-chief selector Kris Srikkanth has said all-rounder Deepak Hooda is a "strong contender" for Team India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "I am telling you...as the ex-chairman of the selection committee. I'm absolutely sure he will be in the final 15 for the World Cup in Australia...What I like about him is guts," stated Srikkanth.

30.title: Cong has lost people's trust: Haryana BJP President Dhankar
30.article_body: Haryana state BJP President OP Dhankar has said that the "Congress has lost the trust of the people". "Its (Congress) leadership is busy covering up corruption cases pending against its top leaders as they were being questioned by the Enforcement Directorate," Dhankar said. "Now the Congress has at least got some issues to hold protests," he added.

31.title: BMW 'driven by ex-MLA' hits multiple vehicles in Delhi, at least 3 injured
31.article_body: A BMW car, allegedly driven by former MLA from Madhya Pradesh, Sunil Jain, hit three to four vehicles on Geeta Colony Flyover in Delhi on Saturday. At least three people were injured in incident, police said. Police added the injured were taken to the hospital. "Jain was driving. His daughter, who lives in Vivek Vihar, was with him," police added.

32.title: A change in attitude, approach was needed after 2021 T20 WC: Rohit
32.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has revealed that they needed a change in their "attitude and approach" after the 2021 T20 World Cup. "When he (Rahul Dravid) became a coach here, we sat together...and he was pretty much on the same thought process as to what I was thinking. That made it a little easier," added Rohit.

33.title: 2 IndiGo engineers struck by lightning at Nagpur airport, hospitalised
33.article_body: Two engineers of IndiGo airline were injured after being struck by lightning at Nagpur's Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport. The incident happened amid heavy rain when the two were on their walkie-talkie, carrying out routine recce for an incoming flight. The engineers are currently in hospital and their condition is reportedly stable.

34.title: Satellites placed in orbit no longer usable: ISRO on its SSLV rocket launch
34.article_body: Hours after the launch of the ISRO's smallest commercial rocket SSLV, the organisation said that the satellites placed in the orbit today "are no longer usable". It said that the satellites were placed in the wrong orbit. "Failure of a logic to identify a sensor failure and go for a salvage action caused the deviation," the ISRO added.

35.title: Work on Pune University Chowk delayed due to monsoon
35.article_body: The work on a two-level integrated flyover at University Chowk, to be developed by the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA), has been delayed due to monsoon. "We had estimated that work would begin in the first week of August but there is a slight delay in completing the road-widening of the main chowk," the project in-charge said.

36.title: SRK, Gauri, Aryan loved 'Darlings', Suhana watched it twice: Alia
36.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said Shah Rukh Khan loved her latest film 'Darlings'. "Shah Rukh saw it and he spoke to me in that Darlings lingo 'thanks yours fors suchs lovelys films'," she added. Alia further said even Gauri Khan, Suhana and Aryan have watched her movie. She added, "They all loved it...They were so kind...Suhana saw it two times."

37.title: NIA arrests active ISIS member from Delhi ahead of Independence Day
37.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Saturday arrested an active member of the Islamic State (ISIS), after conducting searches at New Delhi's Batla House. According to the agency, the accused was involved in collecting funds for ISIS from sympathisers in India and abroad. He was sending these funds to Syria in the form of cryptocurrency, NIA said.

38.title: Boxer Amit Panghal wins India's 15th gold medal at CWG 2022
38.article_body: Indian boxer Amit Panghal on Sunday defeated England's Kiaran MacDonald in the final of the men's over 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category to bag his maiden gold medal at CWG. With this, he took India's gold medal tally at CWG 2022 to 15. Amit had bagged silver medal at CWG 2018 in Gold Coast in his first-ever CWG final.

39.title: Karan Johar hosts 'JugJugg Jeeyo' success party, Kiara shares pics
39.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani shared pictures of the success party, hosted by Karan Johar, for her film 'JugJugg Jeeyo' on Instagram. She captioned the post, "Thank you for the abundant love for our film 'JugJugg Jeeyo'. Raj Mehta (director) is there a sequel in the waiting?" The entire cast of the film, including director Raj, could be seen in the photos.

40.title: Stop process for PMC polls till further notice: SEC tells civic body
40.article_body: The State Election Commission (SEC) has directed Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to halt its poll process till further notice. Its order comes amid an ordinance issued by state government, which has sought to amend clauses of the Maharashtra Municipal Corporation Act. Through the amendment, the previous method to fix the number of corporators for each municipal poll will be restored.

41.title: Eventually, I'll be tired of acting; hope to be a mom: Selena Gomez
41.article_body: Actress-singer Selena Gomez has said that she hopes to be married and be a mother. "Eventually, I'm going to be tired of all of this, so I'm probably just going to devote most of my life to philanthropy before I peace out," she further added. The 30-year-old had recently featured in 'Only Murders in the Building'.

42.title: Deal to take Trump's Truth Social app public needs extension, its buyer says
42.article_body: Digital World Acquisition Corp, the blank-cheque company taking former US President Donald Trump's Truth Social app public, on Friday announced a special meeting of shareholders to approve an extension to the cut-off date of merger completion. The termination date to complete the merger is September 8, 2022. Digital World is seeking to extend the date by 12 months.

43.title: 21-year-old Nitu Ghanghas wins India's first boxing gold medal at CWG 2022
43.article_body: Indian boxer Nitu Ghanghas has bagged India’s first boxing gold medal at CWG 2022. The 21-year-old defeated World Championships 2019 bronze medallist Demie-Jade Resztan of England in the final of over 45kg-48kg (minimumweight) category. Nitu is the second Indian woman boxer after Mary Kom to win a gold medal in CWG history.

44.title: SpiceJet flyers walk on Delhi airport's tarmac after waiting for bus: Reports
44.article_body: Several flyers who disembarked from SpiceJet's Hyderabad-Delhi flight on Saturday night reportedly walked on the tarmac after waiting for a bus for nearly 45 minutes. SpiceJet said there was a brief delay in the arrival of coaches and later all passengers travelled on them. Passengers aren't allowed to walk on the Delhi airport's tarmac area due to security issues.

45.title: India win a medal in women's hockey at CWG after 16 years, clinch bronze
45.article_body: The Indian women's hockey team bagged a medal at Commonwealth Games (CWG) after 16 years by clinching a bronze medal at CWG 2022. India defeated New Zealand 2-1 in the penalty shootout in the bronze medal match on Sunday. Overall, it is India's third CWG medal in women's hockey after gold in 2002 and silver in 2006.

46.title: Remarkable Bhavina Patel gives us one more occasion to be proud: PM Modi
46.article_body: Praising Bhavina Patel after she became the first-ever Indian to win a gold medal in para table tennis at CWG, PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter and wrote, "The remarkable Bhavina gives us one more occasion to be proud!" He added, "Hope her achievements motivate India's youth to pursue table tennis." Bhavina won gold in women's singles classes 3-5 event.

47.title: WhatsApp to get login approval feature to prevent hacking: Report
47.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a new security feature, called Login Approval, that will allow users to protect themselves from potential scammers, according to a report by WABetaInfo. This new feature will allow users to receive notifications when a user logs in to their WhatsApp account from a different device. WhatsApp is currently testing a beta version of Login Approval.

48.title: Kerala to conduct workshop for HNIs aspiring to be angel investors
48.article_body: The Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM) will be conducting a free workshop for high net-worth individuals (HNIs) who aim to be angel investors. Scheduled for August 13, the event will be led by experienced venture capitalists and investors. The workshop is a part of a larger conference called 'Startup Saturday - Funding and Investments' and it will be held in Kochi.

49.title: Rajasthan worst hit by lumpy skin disease, 11 districts affected: Union Minister
49.article_body: Rajasthan has been worst hit by the outbreak of lumpy skin disease, Union Animal Husbandry Minister Parshottam Rupala said, while adding that cases are being reported from 11 districts. Rupala cautioned people against drinking the milk of the affected cows and said such animals should be isolated. The vaccination of healthy animals should be done, he added.

50.title: Explosive detection dog Oli dies after 10 yrs of service with UP Police
50.article_body: Explosive detection dog Oli passed away on Saturday after over 10 years of service with Uttar Pradesh Police. A condolence parade was organised for Oli and her body was placed in front of the martyr memorial at the Police Lines. Oli was trained at National Dog Training Centre in Gwalior and was admitted to the rank of constable in 2012.

51.title: Mr Gehlot should stop speaking the language of rapist: Delhi Commission for Women chief
51.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's Chairperson Swati Maliwal on Sunday said, "Mr Ashok Gehlot should stop speaking the language of rapist." This comes after Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said,  "Incidents of murder after rape have increased due to the law on the hanging of culprits after the Nirbhaya case." Maliwal added that Gehlot's statement hurt the sentiment of all rape survivors.

52.title: SpiceJet flyers walk on Delhi airport's tarmac after waiting for bus for 45 minutes
52.article_body: Several passengers of SpiceJet's Hyderabad-Delhi flight walked on Delhi airport's tarmac on Saturday night after the airline failed to provide a bus for 45 minutes to take them to the terminal, PTI reported. It added that the DGCA has launched a probe into the incident. Denying the report, SpiceJet said the passengers "barely walked a few metres" on the tarmac.

53.title: Pic shows crowded petrol pump after after Bangladesh hikes petrol price by over 50%
53.article_body: A picture has surfaced online, showing a crowded fuel station in Bangladesh after the nation's government announced a hike of 51.2% in petrol price and 42.5% in diesel price. "The new prices will not seem tolerable to everyone. But we had no other choice," Bangladeshi minister Nasrul Hamid said. Violent protests were also reported in parts of the country.

54.title: India will certainly test us: Aus Women's Beth Mooney on CWG cricket final
54.article_body: Australia Women opener Beth Mooney has said India Women will certainly test them in their women's T20 cricket gold medal match at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Sunday. "We know their style of play, they know ours too, so I think it'll be a great contest," she added. India defeated England by four runs in the semi-final on Saturday.

55.title: 3 minor boys booked in Noida for posting morphed photo of girl
55.article_body: Three minor boys have been booked by Noida Police for allegedly morphing a picture of a minor girl and posting it on social media. They are in the same school. The boys had allegedly clicked a picture of the girl standing with her friend some time ago, police said. The girl's statement hasn't been taken as she is COVID-19 positive.

56.title: 3 children injured in celebratory firing in Delhi's Seelampur
56.article_body: Three children got injured on Saturday evening in a celebratory firing by a guest during a function in Delhi's Seelampur. The children, aged between 7 and 8, have been hospitalised and are out of danger. The accused fired a bullet which rebounded from the ground and its pellets hit the children playing nearby. Efforts are on to arrest him.

57.title: Store owner identifies biker who brought shooter in MM Kalburgi's house
57.article_body: A store owner has identified a motorcycle rider who had brought the shooter to deceased Kannada scholar MM Kalburgi's house. The store owner identified Praveen Chatur as the man who was waiting outside on a motorcycle when the murder was committed in 2015. The trial in the Kalburgi murder case began earlier this year.

58.title: 1 dead, 121 injured, 17 firefighters missing in Cuban oil facility fire
58.article_body: A fire triggered by lightning and four subsequent explosions at an oil storage facility in Cuban city of Matanzas left one person dead, 121 people injured and 17 firefighters missing. Authorities say 800 people have been evacuated from a neighbourhood near the Matanzas Supertanker Base. Mexico, Venezuela, Russia, Nicaragua, Argentina and Chile have offered to help put out fire.

59.title: Repos founder shares how Ratan Tata became their mentor, says 'Don't try this method'
59.article_body: Sharing how Ratan Tata became Repos Energy's mentor, founder Aditi Walunj wrote, "We sent handwritten letters to him, reached out to some right people and waited for 12 hours outside his house." Walunj said Tata called them at 10 pm after they had returned to hotel, asking to meet. "PS: Do not try [this] method to meet sir," she added.

60.title: Strong ties with Pacific Islands is President Biden's priority: US
60.article_body: US Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman said that US President Joe Biden sees strong ties with Pacific Island countries as a priority. During a World War Two memorial event in Honiara, Sherman said, "We built profound, enduring ties with each other, as Pacific family". Sherman is on a trip to visit Samoa, Tonga, Solomon Islands, Australia and New Zealand.

61.title: N Kalaiselvi becomes first woman DG of CSIR
61.article_body: Nallathamby Kalaiselvi has become the first woman Director General of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), which is a consortium of 38 research institutes across the country. She has been appointed for a two-year term. She is currently involved in the development of practically viable sodium-ion/lithium-sulfur batteries.

62.title: Rahul Gandhi remembers Tagore on his death anniversary
62.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi remembered philosopher Rabindranath Tagore on his death anniversary. ”Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high...Where words come out from the depth of truth...Into that heaven of freedom, my father, let my country awake,” Rahul quoted Tagore’s poem from Gitanjali. He passed away on this day in the year 1941.

63.title: Gujarat school students form human chain to mark 75th Independence Day
63.article_body: Nearly 400 school students created a human chain in the shape of the number 75 to mark India's 75th Independence Day as part of the Centre's Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav initiative. A drone-shot video shows the students creating the human formation. The event was organised on August 5 in line with PM Modi's call for the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign.

64.title: Man kills 3 women, hides body parts to take revenge on girlfriend's behalf in Karnataka
64.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly murdering three women and disposing of their severed body parts in Karnataka, officials said. The man allegedly told the police that he murdered the women to take revenge on behalf of his girlfriend, who accused them of forcing her into prostitution. He was planning to murder five more people, police said.

65.title: RS Prasad says startup 'unicorn means revenue is $1 billion'; Tharoor replies
65.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad recently said, "I don't know whether Rahul Gandhi knows the meaning of unicorn...But a unicorn means your revenue is $1 billion," after the Congress leader reportedly mocked 'Startup India'. Responding to Prasad's remark, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "BJP leaders have difficulty in learning the difference between revenue and valuation."

66.title: Anupam Kher meets Rajinikanth at Rashtrapati Bhavan, shares pic
66.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Anupam Kher shared photo with actor Rajinikanth from the Rashtrapati Bhavan. "There is no one like my friend Rajinikanth, neither there will be nor there was ever. Jai Ho," the veteran actor captioned the post. The duo met at the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' event at the Rashtrapati Bhavan.

67.title: BJP MP criticises Telangana CM for skipping NITI Aayog meet
67.article_body: BJP MP K Laxman criticised Telangana CM KCR for skipping the NITI Aayog meeting, alleging that the decision will harm the state. “This is the most unfortunate politics as it has nothing to do with NITI Aayog. Boycotting the meet will not cause loss to him but it is a big loss for the state,” said Laxman.

68.title: Road to Pathankot Airport washes away due to increased water flow in river
68.article_body: The road leading to Pathankot Airport has been washed away due to torrential rains and increased water flow in the Chakki river, which flows across Punjab and Himachal Pradesh before joining Beas close to Pathankot. While there is no rain predicted for Punjab over the next five days, widespread to moderate rainfall is predicted for Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand.

69.title: Bengaluru to increase metro train frequency during non-peak hours
69.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced that the frequency of metro trains during non-peak hours will be increased from Monday. The metro currently runs with a 20-minute interval between 5am to 6am and 10pm to 11pm. Following the announcement, trains will run at a frequency of a 15-minute interval during the same timings.

70.title: CRPF, Assam Police take out 'Tiranga Yatra'
70.article_body: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel along with the Assam Police took out a ‘Tiranga Yatra’ to spread awareness among people in the wake of ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign. “I request everyone to turn the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign into a mass movement by hoisting the national flag between August 13 and 15,” said a CRPF official.

71.title: Waterlogging in several areas in Delhi, Gurugram after heavy rain; pics surface
71.article_body: Parts of South Delhi and Gurugram received heavy rain on Sunday morning, following which, water logging was reported on several key roads. Gurugram Police shared pictures of water clogged areas including Artimis Chowk, Sikanderpur power house and Wazirabad red light. Several areas of Delhi including Palam, Aya Nagar and Pusa Road witnessed heavy rain on Sunday, reports said.

72.title: In Goa, rebel MLAs danced as if they were in bar: Aaditya Thackeray
72.article_body: Shiv Sena's Aaditya Thackeray said Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led government is "illegal" and would not last long. "In Goa, these rebels (MLAs) danced as if they were in bar when Uddhav Thackeray resigned as CM," Aaditya Thackeray added. Earlier, a video surfaced showing rebel Maharashtra MLAs dancing at a hotel in Goa after Shinde's name was announced as next CM.

73.title: He forced her to relieve in truck, sent us videos: Father after daughter's suicide in US
73.article_body: The father of 30-year-old Mandeep Kaur who died by suicide in US after domestic abuse by her husband said that her husband kidnapped her nine months back and kept her locked in a truck's container for five days. He added, "He forced my daughter to relieve herself in the container and then sent us her videos of cleaning the container."

74.title: 8 of top 10 most valued firms added ₹98,234.82 crore in m-cap last week
74.article_body: Among the top 10 most valued firms, eight companies together added ₹98,234.82 crore in market valuation last week. While the market valuation of Infosys jumped by ₹28,170.02 crore to reach ₹6,80,182.93 crore, TCS' valuation jumped by ₹23,582.58 crore to ₹12,31,362.26 crore. M-cap of LIC also surged by ₹6,008.75 crore to ₹4,34,748.72 crore.

75.title: 'KGF 2' & 'Laal...' are poles apart, deserved solo releases: Naga Chaitanya
75.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya opened up about his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' avoiding a clash with Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "I've watched 'KGF'...I've also watched 'Laal Singh Chaddha'...both have a very different texture to it...both are poles apart and both deserve their space," he said. "Both are brilliantly made films...I'm happy...both the films got their solo releases," he added.

76.title: You can see that pattern: Parthiv on Rohit's bowling changes
76.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said there's a pattern in Team India captain Rohit Sharma's bowling changes in T20Is. "A left-arm spinner usually bowls the fourth or the fifth over. Ravindra Jadeja, whenever he played, he bowled that fourth or fifth over. [In the fourth WI T20I]...also Axar came in," stated Parthiv. India won the fourth T20I by 59 runs.

77.title: In 2-3 years, nobody’s going to want to play ODIs: Moeen Ali
77.article_body: Amid the talks over the future of ODIs, England all-rounder Moeen Ali has said, "I think the interest in 50-over cricket is not there as it probably once was." He added, "I genuinely feel in two to three years' time, nobody's going to want to play it." Moeen further said that ODIs are already like "the long, boring" format.

78.title: Former UP minister's son injured in accidental firing at residence
78.article_body: The son of a former Samajwadi Party minister sustained bullet injuries near his chest at his residence in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Saturday. The 22-year-old has been admitted to RML hospital where his condition is said to be critical. As per police, the victim was cleaning the revolver issued in the name of his father when the incident occurred.

79.title: Mumbai court declares Australian couple as legal parents of boy after 3 yrs
79.article_body: A court in Mumbai declared an Australian couple as biological and legal parents of their son, three years after he was born via surrogacy. The court allowed them to take the boy from custody of surrogate mother and take him to Australia. They had alleged that surrogate mother did not cooperate in completing paperwork for taking the boy to Australia.

80.title: Mass vaccination of cattle needed to tackle lumpy skin disease: Indian-American vet
80.article_body: President of the American Association of Veterinarians of Indian Origin, Ravi Murarka, has called for mass vaccination of cattle and immediate restriction on their inter-district movement to prevent spread of lumpy skin disease in India. "The situation is very serious in Rajasthan," Murarka added. "It's important to control mosquitoes or keep the vector away from susceptible animals," he stated.

81.title: Alia Bhatt charges ₹85 lakh to ₹1 crore for a social media post: Report
81.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt reportedly charges between ₹85 lakh to a crore for a social media ad or post. According to an influencer marketing executive, the amount can go higher during a release. According to Duff and Phelps' celebrity brand valuation report in 2021, her brand value was calculated to be $68.1 million and she is the youngest among top 10.

82.title: Alibaba fires over 9,000 employees to cut expenses: Report
82.article_body: Billionaire Jack Ma-founded tech conglomerate Alibaba has laid off over 9,000 employees in three months to cut expenses amid slowing sales, South China Morning Post reported. The company's employee headcount fell from 2,54,941 in March to 2,45,700 at the end of June, its quarterly results showed. This marks Alibaba's first drop in payroll size since March 2016, the publication said.

83.title: Shahid Kapoor to team up with Rosshan Andrrews for a thriller: Reports
83.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor is reportedly in talks to team up with Rosshan Andrrews for a thriller film. A source said, "It's in the pre-production stage and will go on floors soon." The film will be produced by Siddharth Roy Kapur. "Rosshan has already met Shahid...to discuss the nitty-gritty of his script...is...excited to make a Hindi film debut," the source added.

84.title: PM Modi to chair NITI Aayog’s Council meet today
84.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will hold the seventh meeting of the NITI Aayog's Governing Council at Rashtrapati Bhavan Cultural Centre in Delhi today. He will talk on a range of topics, including the National Education Policy, agri-communities and urban governance, etc. The meet session is expected to last for around six hours and will be conducted by Union Minister Rajnath Singh.

85.title: Sculpture of Putin riding a tank appears in US park, pics show kids playing with it
85.article_body: A red-coloured sculpture of Russian President Vladimir Putin riding a miniature war tank has been installed in a playground in New York City's famous Central Park. French artist James Colomina took credit for the sculpture and said, "[It] aims at denouncing the absurdity of war and at highlighting children's courage." Colomina had previously installed similar sculptures in Barcelona and Paris.

86.title: 3-storey building caves in Bengaluru due to heavy rains
86.article_body: Amid incessant rainfall, a three-storey building collapsed in Bengaluru’s Chickpet area. No loss of life has been reported as the incident took place on early Saturday morning when nobody was in the building. The India Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rains in 27 districts of the Karnataka. As many as six districts have been put on red alert.

87.title: Prakash Raj donates free ambulance in memory of late actor Puneeth
87.article_body: Actor Prakash Raj, taking to Twitter, has said that his Prakash Raj Foundation has donated a free ambulance in the memory of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar. "'Appu Xpress' donated a free ambulance for the needy in memory of our dear Puneeth Rajkumar, a Prakash Raj Foundation initiative. The joy of giving back to life," he tweeted.

88.title: ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign will be a success: Kerala CM
88.article_body: Talking about 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, Kerala CM P Vijayan claimed that it will be a huge success. All programmes under the campaign are scheduled to start from August 13. “All preparatory activities are completed and the programmes from August 13 to 15 will be a big success,” said Vijayan. The campaign aims to encourage people to hoist the flag.

89.title: Gujarat couple arrested after burying newborn girl alive in farm
89.article_body: Police have arrested a couple in Gujarat after they buried their newborn baby girl alive in a farm. The child was rescued from under the soil with her umbilical cord still attached. The parents stated that they didn't abandon her because she was a girl but because she was born undersized and unhealthy and they couldn't pay for her treatment.

90.title: Anyone can have 1 or 2 bad games, we want to keep skills in mind: Rohit
90.article_body: Talking about pacer Avesh Khan's performance in the ongoing WI T20I series, captain Rohit Sharma said, "We do understand Avesh's talent. Anyone can have one or two bad games, but we want to keep his skills in mind." He added, "We want to give boys enough game time in the middle." Avesh recorded figures of 2/17 in the fourth T20I.

91.title: 15-year-old falls to death from roof after going to get ball in UP
91.article_body: A 15-year-old boy fell to his death from the roof of the Rajarshi Mandapam building's third floor in Uttar Pradesh. The boy had gone there to collect his cricket ball. Police said that the middle of the third floor of the building was covered with a plastic cover. His body was found covered in blood inside the Rajarshi Mandapam hall.

92.title: India releases statement after Indian-origin woman's suicide in US after domestic abuse
92.article_body: The Indian Embassy in New York has released a statement after a 30-yr-old Indian-origin woman allegedly died by suicide over domestic abuse by her husband. "We are deeply saddened by the death of Mandeep Kaur...under most tragic circumstances. We are in touch with the US authorities at Federal and local level as well as the community," it stated.

93.title: Lawyer who fought case against Salman Khan hits constable with speeding car, killing him
93.article_body: A constable in Jodhpur died after he was hit by a speeding car being driven by lawyer Mahipal Bishnoi, who represented Bishnoi community in the blackbuck poaching case against Salman Khan, police said. The incident took place on Friday night when constable Ramesh Saran (27) was on night duty. He was rushed to AIIMS, where he succumbed to his injuries.

94.title: Rise in incidents of murder after rape due to law on hanging of culprits: Gehlot
94.article_body: Congress leader Ashok Gehlot said, "Due to law on the hanging of culprits after the Nirbhaya case, the incidents of murder after rape have increased." He added, "This is a dangerous trend being seen in the country." "The rapist feels that the victim will become a witness against the accused…the accused finds it right to kill the victim," Gehlot stated.

95.title: Remo was a background dancer in song 'Rangeela Re' 27 years ago: Urmila
95.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar said that choreographer Remo D'Souza was a background dancer in her movie 'Rangeela'. "He was also there in the song [Rangeela Re] with me 27 years ago...he was a background dancer, and he was at early stage of his career. Having said that, I must add that I have seen him grow day by day," she added.

96.title: 'Laal...' is not just songs, sex, heroines, item number: Kareena Kapoor
96.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan, in an interview, was asked what she misses in Hindi films. To this, Kareena replied, "We are missing stories nowadays, but 'Laal Singh Chaddha' will change that perception." She further said, "It's not a run-of-the-mill kind of story. It's not just songs, sex, heroines, item number and with two scenes sort of a formula film."

97.title: Result was foreordained: Congress' Shashi Tharoor on VP poll result
97.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor congratulated Opposition's Vice Presidential candidate Margaret Alva for contesting the election against NDA’s Jagdeep Dhankhar. "Congratulations Margaret Alva for fighting the good fight with grace and conviction. The result was foreordained but as the Gita teaches us, one must do the right thing without heed to the outcome," Tharoor tweeted.

98.title: I don't watch movies, don't know about 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Annu Kapoor
98.article_body: A video has surfaced online wherein actor Annu Kapoor when asked about Aamir Khan's upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "What is that? I don't watch movies, I don't know". While his manager intervened to say "no comments", Kapoor said, "It's not about 'no comments'. I don't watch movies, be it mine or others. I don't know about this."

99.title: Will try to continue the good performance: Vinesh after CWG gold
99.article_body: After winning the gold medal at CWG 2022, wrestler Vinesh Phogat said she'll try to continue her "good performance" in upcoming competitions. "It was a good feeling when people were supporting us (inside the stadium). I was able to execute what I learned during my training," she added. Vinesh has now won three gold medals in CWG history.

100.title: Akshay got home-cooked food daily, took orders from us: Raksha Bandhan actor
100.article_body: 'Raksha Bandhan' actor Sahil Mehta said that actor Akshay Kumar used to get home-cooked food for team everyday. "He would take orders from us (actors playing his sisters and me) on what to cook for tomorrow as he would inform his team, 'Ask them to cook this tomorrow'. We were served rajma chawal, cakes and what not," he added.

101.title: 'Laga chunari mein daag', sings Anil Vij while reacting to Congress' protest
101.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Saturday reacted to Congress’ protest in black clothes. On being asked about the protest, Vij sang, "Laga chunari mein daag, chhupau kaise...bach jaau kaise?" "The main problem is this," he added. Earlier, Congress leaders used to wear white clothes but with time their clothes have become black because of their "black deeds," Vij stated.

102.title: Pooja, your medal calls for celebrations, not apology: PM on CWG bronze medallist's video
102.article_body: Reacting to a video wherein wrestler Pooja Gehlot got emotional during a press conference and apologised to the countrymen for winning bronze medal instead of gold at CWG 2022, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Pooja...your medal calls for celebrations, not an apology." He added, "Your life journey motivates us, your success gladdens us. You are destined for great things ahead...keep shining!"

103.title: LetsVenture joins govt scheme to invest $100,000 in startups
103.article_body: Investor syndicate platform LetsVenture has collaborated with the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology's SAMRIDH scheme to help early-stage startups secure $100,000 in funds. LetsVenture was selected under Accelerator programme earlier this year. The venture capital firm said it will support eight startups in the first phase with focus on sectors like deep-tech, gaming and fintech.

104.title: Gurugram class 9 boy dies by electrocution, dad says 'No doctor was present'
104.article_body: A class nine student died after he was allegedly electrocuted while he was returning from school in Gurugram. His father said the 14-year-old boy was rushed to hospital from where he was referred to another hospital but no doctor was present in emergency ward. "He kept lying there for 25 minutes...By the time I reached...he had died," his father said.

105.title: Being tolerant of others' opinions doesn’t mean blind conformity: Justice Chandrachud
105.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said that being accepting or tolerant of others’ opinions does not mean "blind conformity" or "not standing up against hate speech". "The words famously attributed to Voltaire, ‘I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to death your right to say it’ must be incorporated into our being," Justice Chandrachud added.

106.title: ISRO's smallest rocket SSLV suffers data loss in final phase after launch
106.article_body: Shortly after the launch of ISRO's smallest commercial rocket SSLV on Sunday, Chairman S Somanath said that while the rocket performed all stages, it suffered some data loss in the terminal phase of the mission. He added, "We are analysing the data to conclude the final outcome of the mission with respect to achieving a stable orbit."

107.title: When Alia and I started dating, we couldn't tell Ayan Mukerji: Ranbir
107.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed that he did not tell filmmaker Ayan Mukerji about his relationship with Alia Bhatt in the beginning. "We couldn't even tell Ayan that we'd started seeing each other, fearing that he would freak out," he said. "Alia, Ayan...I have spent so much time making 'Brahmastra'...so much has changed in our lives over the years," Ranbir added.

108.title: Next target is World Championships: Ravi Dahiya after CWG gold
108.article_body: After winning the gold in the men's freestyle 57kg event at CWG 2022, wrestler Ravi Dahiya said his next target is to bag the gold medal at the World Wrestling Championships. "I came here (CWG 2022) to win a gold medal...and achieved it. My next target is World Championships," he stated. Dahiya had won bronze in the 2019 World Championships.

109.title: Don't want to make filthy film, want to make family entertainers: Akshay
109.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that he wants to try his hand at different types of content. However, the actor added, "I don't want to make a ghinoni (filthy) film. Even if it is a psycho-thriller movie or a social drama, it should be viewed by families without any hesitancy." Akshay will next be seen in 'Raksha Bandhan'.

110.title: Man arrested for posing as Lawrence Bishnoi's gang member in Panipat
110.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly posing as a member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang and demanding ₹20 lakh extortion from a trader in Haryana's Panipat. The accused has been identified as a resident of Vidhyanand colony who runs a mobile repair and accessory shop. He had threatened to kill the victim's family if the money was not paid.

111.title: US supports Israel's right to defend itself, urges de-escalation
111.article_body: Responding to the recent exchange of fires between Israel and Gaza, US State Department said on Saturday that it supports Israel's right to defend itself. US urged all sides to de-escalate and expressed concern over reports of civilian deaths, calling for "a timely and thorough" probe. Gaza Health Ministry said at least 24 Palestinians, including six children, have been killed.

112.title: Rapper Young Slo-Be shot dead at the age of 29 in California
112.article_body: Rapper Young Slo-Be was shot dead at the age of 29 in California, US, the company which worked with Slo-Be confirmed. "This senseless act of violence has taken a man from his family and leaves a huge void in...music community," Thizzler On The Roof said. Slo-Be was the artist behind 'I Love You', a song that went viral on TikTok.

113.title: US Democrats' climate and health care bill gets Senate's nod
113.article_body: US Senate has passed Democrats' Inflation Reduction Act by 51-50 votes with US Vice President Kamala Harris casting the deciding vote. The bill allocates $370 billion towards clean energy and climate at a time when heatwaves and floods have been witnessed across the country. Bill also aims to make changes to Medicare to negotiate prices of certain costly prescribed drugs.

114.title: India reports 18,738 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate at 5.02%
114.article_body: India reports 18,738 new COVID-19 cases and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, including 8 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,34,933, while the daily positivity rate stood at 5.02%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,689.

115.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway posts $43.8 billion loss in Q2 earnings
115.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway, led by the world's eighth richest person Warren Buffett, reported a $43.8 billion loss in its second-quarter earnings. The company attributed the loss to disruptions caused by COVID-19 and geopolitical conflicts including Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Berkshire also repurchased $1 billion of its own stock in the quarter and has repurchased $4.2 billion this year.

116.title: Security increased, Delhi Police use face recognition software before I-Day
116.article_body: Security in Delhi has been increased ahead of India's 75th Independence Day. A drive involving Delhi Police making use of facial recognition software (FRS) on "vagabonds" or "people with suspicious movement" was launched a month ago. "[Police] have been taking pictures and details of 'vagabonds' like their names, ages, native places, reason for shifting, and period of stay," police said.

117.title: 8 killed, 22 injured in bomb blast in shopping street in Kabul; IS claims responsibility
117.article_body: A bomb blast in a busy shopping street in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Saturday killed eight people and injured 22, officials said. The bomb exploded in an area of the city where members of the minority Shi'ite Muslim community regularly meet. Islamic State, a Sunni Muslim militant group, claimed responsibility for the attack, the group said on its Telegram channel.

118.title: Sagar Ahlawat reaches men's super heavyweight boxing final at CWG
118.article_body: Boxer Sagar Ahlawat has reached the gold medal bout at CWG 2022 by defeating Nigeria's Ifeanyi Onyekwere in the semi-final of the men's over 92kg (super heavyweight) category. Sagar is the fourth Indian boxer to reach the gold medal bout in the ongoing games after Nikhat Zareen, Amit Panghal and Nitu Ghanghas. He'll face England's Delicious Orie in the final.

119.title: Can anything be more preposterous?: Cong leader on protest linked to Ram Mandir
119.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Kumar Bansal reacted to Union Home Minister Amit Shah linking the party’s protest to Ram Mandir’s foundation day. "Can anything be more preposterous than the allegation that the Congress organised a protest against price rise on August 5, as the foundation stone of Ram Temple was laid on this day?" Bansal tweeted.

120.title: ISRO launches its smallest rocket SSLV carrying satellite made by 750 school girls
120.article_body: The ISRO today launched its smallest commercial rocket, SSLV, from Sriharikota. It is designed to carry satellites up to 500 kg and is a low-cost vehicle due to its low turnaround time. It is carrying an Earth Observation Satellite and AzadiSAT, a satellite built by 750 school girls from across India to mark the 75th Independence Day.

121.title: Govt worshipping 'Raavan' in name of 'Ram': Congress' Adhir Chowdhury
121.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury reacted to Union Minister Amit Shah linking the party’s protest to Ram Mandir’s foundation day. "In the name of 'Ram', this government has been worshipping 'Raavan'," Chowdhury said. The Congress leader further said, "People are afflicted under their rule." Congress "exposed" this government as anti-people and pro-corporate, Chowdhury stated.

122.title: Early Amazon investor & board member Tom Alberg passes away aged 82
122.article_body: Tom Alberg, the Founder of Seattle-based venture capital company Madrona Venture Group, has passed away at the age of 82 after suffering a stroke last month. Alberg was an early Amazon investor and served as its board member for 23 years. Condoling his death, Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos tweeted, "Tom was a visionary and also just a wonderful, good man."

123.title: I look up to Ajay Devgn's career as a reference point: Arjun Kapoor
123.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said that he looks up to actor Ajay Devgn's career as a reference point. "For me, he is an inspiration. The way he has managed to cultivate his audience," the 'Ek Villain Returns' actor added. "Subconsciously, I've always meandered towards following his career...I would like to learn from him," Arjun further stated.

124.title: Was trolled in school for being raised by single parent, there was rage: Masaba
124.article_body: Actress Masaba Gupta said that she was trolled in school for being raised by a single parent and the nature of her parents' relationship. "But I was like, 'Your father, your mother are everywhere. That's allowed?' There was a lot of rage that time but now I just laugh it off," she added.

125.title: I feel good because I didn't do well in the last two games: Avesh on 2/17 vs WI
125.article_body: India pacer Avesh Khan said he's feeling good after being named 'Player of the Match' in the fourth T20I against West Indies as he couldn't do well in previous games in the five-match series. "My coaches and my captain told me that they were backing me," he added. Avesh registered figures of 0/47 and 1/31 in the last two games.

126.title: 4 people shot dead in US' Ohio, FBI releases pics of suspect and his vehicle
126.article_body: FBI has released details of a suspect named Stephen A Marlow, who allegedly killed four people including an old couple and a mother-daughter in Ohio on Friday. Marlow was described as 5'11" and about 160 pounds, with brown hair. Authorities believe Marlow, 39, was wearing shorts and a yellow T-shirt and fled in a white 2007 Ford Edge.

127.title: PMC to set up incinerators to dispose of fish, chicken, mutton waste
127.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to separately collect fish, chicken and mutton waste from sellers. The civic body plans to set up a new incinerator facility to dispose of this waste. PMC said that a separate collection system will be put in place. An official said that as per existing practice, this waste is mixed with all other waste.

128.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 14 medals in 1 day?
128.article_body: India clinched 14 medals on Day 9 of CWG 2022, including four gold medals. India have won 13 gold medals at the Games so far and are currently placed fifth on the medal standings. Second-placed England became the second country after leaders Australia to bag at least 50 gold medals. Canada are placed third with 22 gold medals.

129.title: Who were India's medallists on Day 9 of CWG 2022 as country bags 14 medals?
129.article_body: Wrestlers Vinesh Phogat, Ravi Dahiya and Naveen clinched gold on Day 9 of CWG 2022. Bhavina Patel bagged para table tennis gold. Athletes Priyanka Goswami and Avinash Sable, and Indian men's fours lawn bowls team bagged silver. Wrestlers Pooja Gehlot, Pooja Sihag & Deepak Nehra, boxers Jaismine, Hussamuddin and Rohit Tokas, and para table tennis player Sonalben Patel won bronze.

130.title: I apologise to countrymen, wished National Anthem be played here: Pooja on her CWG bronze
130.article_body: Wrestler Pooja Gehlot, who won India a bronze medal in the women's freestyle 50 kg category at CWG 2022, got emotional during a press conference. In the press conference, she said, "I apologise to my countrymen. It was my wish that National Anthem be played here [because of me]." She added, "I'll learn from my mistakes and work on them."

131.title: Elon Musk challenges Twitter CEO Parag to public debate on bots amid legal battle
131.article_body: Elon Musk has challenged Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal to a public debate about the percentage of bots on Twitter amid the ongoing legal battle over $44-billion buyout deal. "Let him prove...that Twitter has <5% fake or spam daily users," Musk tweeted. He also started a poll asking users whether less than 5% of Twitter's daily users are fake or spam.

132.title: Mobile data services suspended in Manipur, Sec 144 in 2 districts after van set ablaze
132.article_body: Mobile data services have been suspended in Manipur for five days after an eco-van was set ablaze by three-four youths, an order by state government said. Section 144 has been imposed in Churachandpur and Bishnupur districts for next two months. The order said that "the crime has created tense communal situation and volatile law and order situation in the state".

133.title: Bhavina Patel creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win gold in para table tennis at CWG
133.article_body: Para table tennis player Bhavina Patel created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win gold medal in para table tennis at CWG. The 35-year-old defeated Nigeria's Ifechukwude Christiana Ikpeoyi in the final of the women's singles classes 3-5 event at CWG 2022. Bhavina had bagged silver at Tokyo Paralympics, which was India's first-ever Paralympic medal in para table tennis.

134.title: India record their 13th consecutive series win vs West Indies in international cricket
134.article_body: India defeated West Indies by 59 runs in the fourth T20I in Florida to take an unassailable 3-1 lead in the five-match series. With this, India recorded their fifth consecutive T20I series victory against West Indies. It is also India's 13th consecutive series victory against West Indies across formats in international cricket.

135.title: Indian wrestler Deepak Nehra defeats Pakistan's Tayab Raza to bag bronze at CWG 2022
135.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Nehra defeated Pakistan's Tayab Raza in the men's freestyle 97 kg event to bag a bronze medal at CWG 2022. With this, India bagged six medals in wrestling at CWG 2022 on Day 9, including three gold and three bronze medals. Overall, India bagged 12 medals in wrestling at CWG 2022.

136.title: India reach men's hockey final for the third time in CWG history
136.article_body: India defeated South Africa 3-2 in men's hockey semi-final at CWG 2022 to reach the final for the third time in the history of CWG. Abhishek, Mandeep Singh and Jugraj Singh scored for India in the semi-final. India will face either Australia or England in the final on Monday. India won silver in the 2010 and 2014 editions of CWG.

137.title: Mohammad Hussamuddin bags India's 2nd boxing medal of the day at CWG 2022
137.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammad Hussamuddin bagged India's second boxing medal of the day at CWG 2022. The 28-year-old lost to Ghana's Joseph Commey in the semi-final of the men's over 54kg-57kg (featherweight) to settle for the bronze. Earlier today, India's Jaismine had won bronze in the women's over 57kg-60kg (lightweight) category.

138.title: US prepares $1 billion weapons package for Ukraine: Report
138.article_body: The President Joe Biden-led US government's next security aid package for Ukraine will be worth around $1 billion, Reuters reported quoting officials. It will reportedly include armoured medical vehicles and munitions for long-range weapons. The US has already given Ukraine aid of about  $8.8 billion since Russia's invasion began on February 24.

139.title: Ukraine detains 2 accused of identifying targets for Russian strikes
139.article_body: Ukraine's State Security Service (SBU) said on Saturday that it has detained two suspected Russian intelligence agents who had identified targets for missile strikes that damaged shipbuilding infrastructure in Mykolaiv. SBU said the accused "collected and transmitted intelligence to the enemy about important infrastructure facilities...and movement of personnel and equipment" of Ukrainian forces.

140.title: Chinese ship to dock in Hambantota for refuelling: Sri Lanka
140.article_body: Chinese research vessel 'Yuan Wang 5' will dock at Hambantota Port in Sri Lanka next week to seek "refuelling and replenishment", Sri Lankan Minister Bandula Gunawardana has said. He reiterated Colombo will not do "anything to harm the good understanding" between India and Sri Lanka. Earlier, India's defence establishment said it would closely follow the visit of the Chinese ship.

141.title: Pakistan Army chief reaches out to Saudi, UAE for financial aid
141.article_body: Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Bajwa has reached out to Saudi Arabia and the UAE to seek financial assistance for Pakistan. The International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Executive Board is set to meet later this month to approve a package of $1.2 billion for Pakistan. Islamabad is in talks with friendly nations to provide supporting funds ahead of the IMF package.

142.title: Pooja Sihag bags bronze as all 6 Indian female wrestlers win medals at CWG 2022
142.article_body: India's 25-year-old wrestler Pooja Sihag defeated Australia's Naomi de Bruine in women's freestyle 76 kg category to bag bronze at CWG 2022. With this, all the six Indian female wrestlers bagged medals at CWG 2022. Anshu Malik bagged silver, while Sakshi Malik and Vinesh Phogat bagged gold medals in their respective categories. Pooja Gehlot and Divya Kakran bagged bronze medals.

143.title: 2 missing girls aged between 4-5 found dead in well in MP
143.article_body: The bodies of two girls were found in a well in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday. The girls had gone missing from their homes in Khargone on Friday, following which an abduction case was registered, a police officer said. "The girls [were] in the four-five age group. Prima facie, it seems they accidentally fell into the well and drowned," he added.

144.title: Maharashtra logs 1,931 new COVID-19 cases, 9 deaths reported
144.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,931 fresh cases of COVID-19 and nine deaths due to the infection on Saturday, the state health department said. Saturday's cases took Maharashtra's active case count to 11,875. Maharashtra's current positivity rate stands at 4.77 per cent, news agency PTI reported. On Friday, the state had reported 2,024 COVID-19 cases and five fatalities due to the virus.

145.title: He is happy to be here: Klopp after Mo Salah renews his Liverpool contract
145.article_body: After forward Mohamed Salah signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool, the English football club's manager Juergen Klopp said that the 30-year-old Egyptian "is in really good shape" and "is happy to be here (Liverpool)". "After a few weeks of holiday, Mo is always full of power...He looked really sharp in the whole pre-season... May it continue," Klopp said.

146.title: Roopali Desai becomes 1st Indian-American judge on US' 9th Circuit
146.article_body: The US Senate has confirmed Arizona lawyer Roopali Desai as the first Indian-American judge on the 9th US Circuit Court of Appeals. Desai was confirmed by the Senate by a bipartisan vote of 67-29 on Thursday. The 9th Circuit, which is the largest of the thirteen courts of appeals, has jurisdiction over nine states and two territories.

147.title: Will defend Philippines if it's attacked in the South China Sea: US
147.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken on Saturday said that the US would come to the defence of the Philippines if it faces hostilities in the South China Sea. Referring to an "ironclad" defence pact between the two countries, Blinken stated, "An armed attack on Philippine armed forces, public vessels and aircraft will invoke US mutual defence commitments under that treaty."

148.title: 19-year-old Naveen defeats Pakistan's Tahir to win India's 12th gold at CWG 2022
148.article_body: India's 19-year-old wrestler Naveen defeated Pakistan's Muhammad Sharif Tahir to bag gold in the men's freestyle 74 kg event, taking India's gold medal tally at CWG 2022 to 12. India have now won a total of 34 medals at CWG 2022, including 11 silver and 11 bronze medals. As many as six Indian wrestlers won gold at CWG 2022.

149.title: Pic shows underwater fog in Mexico, photographer says 'It's like another world'
149.article_body: Divers exploring the caverns of Mexico shared photos of the descent into swirling fog caused by alternating layers of fresh water and salt water, creating the illusion of a river underwater. Underwater photographer Francis Perez dived into a cenote called 'El Pit' in Yucatan, Mexico. "It's like flying over a river...It's like another world, a mysterious place," said Perez.

150.title: Sharath enters men's, mixed doubles finals, assures India of 2 more CWG medals
150.article_body: Table tennis player Sharath Kamal assured India of at least two more medals at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham. The 40-year-old reached the finals of both the men's doubles and mixed doubles on Saturday. Sharath and Sathiyan Gnanasekaran won the men's doubles semi-final 3-2. Later, Sharath and Sreeja Akula won the mixed doubles semi-final 3-2.

151.title: What a steady rise to the top Dahiya: Anurag Thakur on wrestler's CWG gold
151.article_body: Reacting to Indian wrestler Ravi Dahiya's gold medal at CWG 2022, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter and wrote, "What a steady rise to the top Ravi Dahiya!" He added, "An Olympic silver last year topped with a CWG gold in 2022, you are truly on a roll." Dahiya won gold in men's freestyle 57 kg final on Saturday.

152.title: Taxi driver arrested for molesting female tourist in Goa
152.article_body: A taxi driver was arrested for allegedly molesting a female tourist on Saturday. The woman had hired the accused's cab to travel to Anjuna after landing at the airport on Friday night, police said. The accused, Mithun Gaur, allegedly touched the complainant inappropriately when she was getting down from the car at Anjuna, police added.

153.title: Policeman beaten by 10-12 men inside police station in Delhi, video surfaces
153.article_body: A video of a policeman being beaten up inside Delhi's Anand Vihar police station has been widely shared online. The clip shows an on-duty head constable being surrounded and assaulted as he sits with folded hands, while no one is seen intervening to stop the miscreants. The incident reportedly took place on August 3 (Wednesday).

154.title: Harshal Patel to miss Asia Cup, doubtful for T20 WC 2022: Report
154.article_body: Indian pacer Harshal Patel is reportedly likely to miss the upcoming Asia Cup tournament and may not even feature in this year's T20 World Cup too. Patel is having a side strain, which needs four-six weeks of rehab, a report said. The 31-year-old is currently with the Indian team in the US for the five-match T20I series against WI.

155.title: City bus submerges in water amid heavy rainfall in Odisha, 20 rescued
155.article_body: A city bus submerged in water at Jatni Pipili Railway underpass in the Khordha district of Odisha on Saturday. This comes as waterlogging was reported in the area amid heavy rainfall. More than 20 passengers were rescued by the public, ANI reported. A video of the incident showed two-three men helping a man in the water.

156.title: I thank all those MPs who voted for Jagdeep Dhankhar in VP poll: PM
156.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday thanked all the Members of Parliament who voted for Jagdeep Dhankhar in the Vice Presidential election. "At a time when India marks Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, we are proud to be having a Kisan Putra Vice President who has excellent legal knowledge and intellectual prowess," he said. PM Modi met Dhankhar to congratulate him.

157.title: Turkey to pay for Russian gas partially in rubles
157.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Saturday said his country will partially pay for Russian gas in rubles and will also extend the use of Russia's Mir payment system. This comes amid the US' international push to sanction Russia after its invasion of Ukraine. Erdogan made the announcements after meeting Russian President Vladimir Putin in Sochi.

158.title: Rohit overtakes Afridi to record 2nd most number of sixes in international cricket
158.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has overtaken Shahid Afridi to record second-most number of sixes in international cricket. With his three sixes in the fourth West Indies T20I, Rohit took his tally of sixes in international cricket to 477. Afridi slammed 476 sixes in 508 innings. With 553 sixes, Chris Gayle holds the record for hitting most sixes in international cricket.

159.title: PM Modi meets Jagdeep Dhankhar, says 'proud to have Kisan Putra VP'
159.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid a visit to Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday to congratulate him soon after the latter was elected as India's Vice President. In a statement, PM Modi said, "We are proud to be having a Kisan Putra Vice President who has excellent legal knowledge and intellectual prowess." BJP President JP Nadda also met Dhankhar following his victory.

160.title: Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' screened at Parliament
160.article_body: Several leaders of the Bharatiya Janata Party attended a special screening of R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' at the Parliament on Friday. Madhavan, who has directed and produced the film in addition to acting in it, said, "I am eternally grateful that the film was so well received." The film is based on former ISRO scientist Nambi Narayanan.

161.title: Kevin Feige wanted to kill all 6 Avengers in Endgame: Joe Russo
161.article_body: 'Avengers: Endgame' co-director Joe Russo revealed that Marvel President Kevin Feige wanted not two, but all six of the original Avengers dead in the film. "Kevin [pitched]...taking all...OGs off the board," he said, adding he and Anthony Russo felt Kevin's pitch was "way too aggressive". Robert Downey Jr's Iron Man and Scarlett Johansson's Black Widow were killed in the movie.

162.title: Proud that Indian flag soared because of me: Priyanka on CWG race walk silver
162.article_body: Priyanka Goswami, who became the first-ever Indian woman to win a silver medal in 10,000 metres race walk at CWG, said she's very proud that the Indian flag soared because of her. "I'm elated," she added. The 26-year-old clocked 43:38.83, her personal best, to win silver on Saturday. Overall, this is India's second medal in race walk at CWG.

163.title: UN chief attends 77th anniversary of atomic bombing in Japan
163.article_body: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres joined Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida at the Hiroshima Peace Park on Saturday to remember the world's first atomic bombing 77 years ago. "Nuclear weapons are nonsense. They guarantee...only death and destruction," Guterres said. US on August 6, 1945, dropped the world's first atomic bomb on Japan, killing 1,40,000 people.

164.title: Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat wins her 3rd gold medal in CWG history
164.article_body: India's 27-year-old wrestler Vinesh Phogat bagged gold medal in the women's freestyle 53 kg category at CWG 2022. Phogat won the gold after winning each of her three matches in the Nordic System group. She beat Canada's Samantha Stewart, Nigeria's Mercy Bolafunoluwa Adekuoroye and Sri Lanka's Chamodya Keshani Maduravalage Don. Vinesh has now won three gold medals in CWG history.

165.title: Ex-Union Minister RCP Singh quits JD(U) amid corruption allegations by party
165.article_body: Hours after Janata Dal (United) reportedly sought an explanation from party leader RCP Singh over corruption allegations against him, the former Union Minister quit the Nitish Kumar-led party. "The allegations are a conspiracy by those who envied my getting inducted into the Union cabinet...Those living in glass houses must not hurl stones at others," Singh said at a press conference.

166.title: I don't hate Vivian; if I dislike someone, why would I've baby with them: Neena
166.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said in an interview that even though she has moved on from her previous relationships, she has never hated her exes. "I believe once you love somebody, how can you hate?" she added. Referring to former West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, Neena said, "If I dislike someone, why would I've a baby with them? Am I mad?"

167.title: Naxalites kill man suspecting him to be a police informer in MP
167.article_body: Naxalites have murdered a man in MP's Balaghat district following suspicion that he was a police informer, an official said on Saturday. The deceased, Lalu Dhurve, was in his late 20s, police said, adding such acts are intended to create fear among the locals. Police said the Naxalites left behind pamphlets, claiming Dhurve was a police informer.

168.title: It's 74%; Let it sink in: BL Santhosh on Dhankar's win in VP polls
168.article_body: BJP's National General Secretary (Organisation) BL Santhosh has commented on the NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar's win in the Vice-President polls. "Dhankhar wins VP elections by securing 528 of the 725 votes," Santhosh said. He added, "It's 74%. Let it sink in. From [a] farm background, distinguished legal luminary will add further value [to] the luminaries who occupied that chair."

169.title: Assam reports 3 deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis, 12 new cases
169.article_body: Three deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis were recorded in Assam on Saturday, as per a release issued by the National Health Mission. According to the release, the state also reported 12 new cases of the infection during the day. Saturday's cases took Assam's tally of Japanese Encephalitis cases reported since the beginning of July to 347.

170.title: The man is also going to have a child: Alia on her reaction to post about her pregnancy
170.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who had criticised a report claiming her pregnancy might delay her Hollywood career, said, "You're not saying that about the man, the man is also going to have the child...Why is it only for the woman?" "You are making a commentary on a woman in general, who is actually working since the beginning of (her) pregnancy," she added.

171.title: Maybe it's not my time, maybe I lack something: Dhawan on not being considered for T20Is
171.article_body: Talking about not being considered by selectors for T20Is, Shikhar Dhawan said, "I feel that there is a time for everything, and maybe it's not my time." He added, "Maybe I lack something that I haven't been able to do too well." He further said, "I gave my best and that's what matters...I am in a very good space."

172.title: Manika Batra's CWG 2022 campaign ends after loss in women's doubles
172.article_body: Indian duo of Manika Batra and Diya Chitale lost in quarter-final of the women's doubles table tennis event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Saturday. Charlotte Carey and Anna Hursey of Wales defeated the Indian team 11-7, 11-6, 11-13, 12-10. With this, Manika's campaign has ended at the ongoing Commonwealth Games. Notably, Manika won four medals in the 2018 edition.

173.title: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya bags India's 10th gold medal at CWG 2022
173.article_body: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya won the men's freestyle 57 kg event on Saturday to bag India's 10th gold medal at Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. The 24-year-old, who had won a silver medal at Tokyo Olympics last year, defeated Nigeria's Ebikewenimo Welson in the final to win his first CWG medal. Out of India's 10 gold medals, four have come from wrestling.

174.title: NMC invites persecuted minorities from Pak to practise medicine in India
174.article_body: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has invited applications from persecuted minorities from Pakistan, who escaped from the country and entered India on or before December 31, 2014, to practise medicine here. The NMC has invited applications from such people who have obtained Indian citizenship for the grant of permanent registration to practise modern medicine or allopathy.

175.title: Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as VP: TN CM
175.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the Vice President of India. "Hope the ideals enshrined in our constitution will be upheld during your tenure besides strengthening the democratic debates in the Upper House," he said. The voting for the Vice Presidential polls was held today.
