176.title: Man gets 10 years in prison for minor's rape in Maharashtra's Latur
176.article_body: A special Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act court in Maharashtra's Latur awarded a 10-year prison sentence to a 50-year-old man for the rape of a minor girl in 2017. The girl was raped by Amol alias Ratnakar Baburao Prayag on January 30, 2017 when she went to the latter's house along with his daughter to play.

177.title: Mob attacks man with swords, hockey sticks for supporting Nupur Sharma in Maha
177.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly attacked by around 14 people carrying swords, sickle, hockey sticks etc in Maharashtra after he showed support for suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police said. Pratik alias Sunny Rajendra Pawar sustained serious injuries on his head and other body parts in the attack. Four people have been detained in connection to the August 4 incident.

178.title: Her husband wanted a son, dowry: Sister of Indian-origin woman who died by suicide in US
178.article_body: The sister of Mandeep Kaur, the Indian-origin woman who died by suicide after eight years of domestic abuse, said her husband Ranjotveer Sandhu started 'torturing' Mandeep as soon as they moved to New York. "He wanted a son and ₹50 lakh dowry," said Kuldeep Kaur. Mandeep's father alleged Sandhu's parents didn't intervene even after they were told about the abuse.

179.title: Congrats to Dhankhar, thank you Alva for representing Opp'n: Rahul
179.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the Vice-President after the latter won the polls by a margin of 346 votes on Saturday. "Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected as the 14th Vice-President of India...Thank you to Margaret Alva for representing the spirit of the joint Opposition with grace and dignity," Rahul tweeted.

180.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar will be an outstanding Vice President: Piyush Goyal
180.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on winning the Vice Presidential elections. "He'll be a wonderful Rajya Sabha Chairman [and] an outstanding Vice President," Goyal said. "The nation is blessed to have the son of a farmer and an eminent jurist as VP of India. We're fortunate we'll have a chance to work with him," he added.

181.title: At least 67 injured after explosion at Cuban fuel storage facility
181.article_body: Fire from the oil tank that was hit by lightning on Friday caused another fuel storage tank to explode near Cuba's supertanker port in Matanzas on Saturday morning. At least 67 people were injured in the blast on Saturday, Cuban state media reported. Notably, this comes at a time when Cuba is already facing daily blackouts and fuel shortages.

182.title: Pooja Gehlot becomes 7th Indian wrestler to win a medal at CWG 2022
182.article_body: India's 25-year-old wrestler Pooja Gehlot has become the seventh Indian wrestler to win a medal at the CWG 2022. Gehlot won a bronze medal in the women's freestyle 50 kg after beating Scotland's Christelle Lemofack Letchidjio 12-2. Overall, India have won 31 medals at CWG 2022 so far.

183.title: Alva congratulates Dhankhar, says 'some Opp'n parties supported BJP'
183.article_body: After Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as the Vice-President of India, Opposition candidate Margaret Alva congratulated him and thanked the MPs who voted for her. Alva wrote on Twitter, "This election was an opportunity for the Opposition to work together...Unfortunately, some Opposition parties chose to directly or indirectly support the BJP...in an attempt to derail the idea of a united Opposition."

184.title: Anil shares pic from 1984 film Mashaal, asks fans to 'guess the actors'
184.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor took to Instagram on Saturday to share a throwback picture from his 1984 film 'Mashaal'. "What rolling into the weekend looks like...I love this pic...Guess the names of the other actors," he wrote alongside the picture. Sanjay Kapoor commented on the post, "Gulshan Grover, Madan Jain, Raj Hans." "It's not Raj Hans," Anil replied.

185.title: Indian shuttler Aakarshi loses in singles semis, crashes out of CWG 2022
185.article_body: India's badminton player Aakarshi Kashyap crashed out of the Commonwealth Games 2022 after losing in quarter-final of the women's singles event in Birmingham on Saturday. The 20-year-old lost 10-21, 7-21 to Scotland's Kirsty Gilmour, a silver and bronze medallist in the 2014 and 2018 editions respectively. With this, Aakarshi's debut campaign ended at the ongoing Commonwealth Games.

186.title: 70-year-old temple priest beaten to death while worshipping in UP
186.article_body: A 70-year-old priest was allegedly beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Sherkot on Saturday, police said. The deceased, Begram, was conducting rituals and worship at Manokamna Mandir around 4:30 am when some unknown assailants reportedly attacked him. After his wife came out hearing his screams, the attackers fled the spot. He was rushed to the hospital but declared brought dead.

187.title: China shouldn't hold global issues hostage: US State Secretary
187.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Saturday said China should not hold hostage discussions on important global issues, such as climate change. US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan recently, triggering a reaction from China which claims Taiwan as its own territory. In retaliation, Beijing cut contacts with Washington on vital issues of military importance and climate cooperation.

188.title: Iran calls for 'realistic' US response to revive nuclear deal
188.article_body: Iran on Saturday called on the US to come up with a "realistic" response to Tehran's proposals for reviving the 2015 nuclear deal, state media reported. This came as Tehran and Washington continued indirect talks for the third day in Vienna to salvage the pact. Under the deal, Iran agreed to limit its nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief.

189.title: Nation will benefit from Dhankhar's experience of public life: Prez
189.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Saturday tweeted, "Congratulations to Jagdeep Dhankhar on being elected the Vice President of India." "The nation will benefit from your long and rich experience of public life. My best wishes for a productive and successful tenure," she said. Notably, Dhankar won by 346 votes as he received 528 of the total 725 votes that were cast.

190.title: Unknown illness killed 61 in Chhattisgarh village in 3 yrs, claim locals
190.article_body: Residents of a remote village in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district claimed 61 people died there in three years due to an unknown illness that causes swollen hands and legs. Preliminary results of water sample examination found high fluoride and iron content in it. "As of now, we cannot say...the deaths were caused due to heavy metal content," an official said.

191.title: Cannot avoid it: Akshay on Raksha Bandhan's clash with Laal Singh Chaddha
191.article_body: Akshay Kumar has said box office clashes between films will happen because of COVID-19. "There are a lot of films that are...completed but...were not able to come out," said Akshay, whose 'Raksha Bandhan' will release on August 11, the same day as Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Now you cannot avoid it...My hope is that both...movies do well," he added.

192.title: BJP uses 'its only weapon Ram' to divert people's attention: Adhir Chowdhury
192.article_body: After Union Minister Amit Shah said Congress insulted the 'Ram bhakts' by protesting in black clothes on Ayodhya Day, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury accused BJP of "resorting to their only weapon Ram" to "divert" the attention of the people from real issue. "It is our...responsibility to raise...issues of...people...But in the name of Amrit Kaal...government has been deceiving...people," he said.

193.title: Kohli, Hassan facing same problem; too much mental pressure: Hafeez
193.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Mohammad Hafeez said that Hassan Ali and Virat Kohli are facing the "same problem". "Kohli is one of the best players of the past 10 years...He needed a break because he had too much mental pressure," Hafeez said. He added, "The management was unfair to [Hassan]...he was played in matches where he could've been rested."

194.title: Election of 'Kisan Putra' Dhankhar as VP is a matter of joy: Shah
194.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar after he was elected as India's Vice-President (VP) on Saturday. Shah tweeted that the election of "Kisan Putra" Dhankhar as the VP is a matter of joy for India. "I'm sure that as Vice President and Chairman of Rajya Sabha [he'll] prove to be an ideal guardian of the Constitution," Shah added.

195.title: Gave financial aid to kin of 789 farmers who died during protest: Mann
195.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday said that his government has completed the process of providing financial assistance to families of 789 farmers who lost their lives during the agitation against the Centre's farm laws. Each family has been given ₹5 lakh. The farmers had died due to various reasons, including harsh winter, road accidents and cardiac arrest.

196.title: Dipika-Saurav lose in mixed doubles squash semis, to play for bronze at CWG
196.article_body: Dipika Pallikal and Saurav Ghosal lost in semi-final of the mixed doubles squash event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Saturday. The Indian duo lost to Joelle King and Paul Coll of New Zealand 7-11, 4-11. Dipika and Saurav will play in the bronze medal match on Sunday. Notably, Ghosal won bronze medal in men's singles on Wednesday.

197.title: Dalai Lama honoured with Ladakh's highest civilian award
197.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama was honoured with Ladakh's highest civilian honour 'dPal rNgam Duston' award for his contribution to humanity on Friday. The 87-year-old was conferred the award by Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council (LAHDC) in Leh on the occasion of Union Territory Declaration Day. LAHDC chief Tashi Gyalson appealed for the conferment of Bharat Ratna on Dalai Lama.

198.title: CISF jawan opens fire at India's largest museum in Kolkata, 1 killed & many hurt
198.article_body: A CISF jawan opened fire at Kolkata's Indian Museum, which is the largest and oldest museum in India, killing one person and injuring several others. Kolkata Police Commissioner said that one ASI was killed and one assistant commandant rank officer was among those injured. The accused jawan, who attacked around 6:30 pm on Saturday, has been captured.

199.title: Satyendar Jain's wife gets interim bail in money laundering case
199.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday granted interim bail to Poonam Jain, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's wife, in a money laundering case. The court directed Poonam to be released on bail on a personal bond of ₹1 lakh and noted that she wasn't arrested during investigation. Meanwhile, Satyendar, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate, also withdrew his interim bail application.

200.title: Confident Jagdeep Dhankhar will make an exceptional VP: Rajnath Singh
200.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on winning the Vice Presidential elections. "His long public life, wide experience and deep understanding of people's issues will certainly benefit the nation," Singh said in a tweet. "I am confident that he will make an exceptional VP & Rajya Sabha Chairman," he added.

201.title: Firing in India's largest museum in Kolkata, 1 killed & many injured
201.article_body: A CISF jawan opened fire at Kolkata's Indian Museum, which is the largest and oldest museum in India, killing one person and injuring several others. Kolkata Police Commissioner said that one ASI was killed and one assistant commandant rank officer was among those injured. The accused jawan, who attacked around 6:30 pm on Saturday, has been captured.

202.title: India announce their playing XI for 4th T20I against West Indies, make 3 changes
202.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the fourth T20I in Florida. India have made three changes to their playing XI, with Ravi Bishnoi, Axar Patel and Sanju Samson replacing Ravichandran Ashwin, Hardik Pandya and Shreyas Iyer. India lead the five-match series 2-1.

203.title: Israel and Palestinian militants exchange fire for 2nd day
203.article_body: Israeli airstrikes on the Gaza Strip and rocket attacks by Palestinian militants on Israel continued for the second day on Saturday. The latest exchange of fire started on Friday after Israel killed an Islamic Jihad commander in an airstrike on a high-rise building in the Palestinian territory. The militants fired at least 160 rockets across the border.

204.title: 20-year-old boxer Jaismine wins India's 30th medal at CWG 2022, clinches bronze
204.article_body: India's 20-year-old boxer Jaismine settled with a bronze medal in the women's over 57kg-60kg (lightweight) category at CWG 2022 after losing the semi-final to England's Gemma Paige Richardson. With Jaismine's bronze medal, India's medal tally at CWG 2022 has reached 30. Earlier, boxers Nitu Ghanghas, Amit Panghal and Nikhat Zareen reached the finals of their respective categories.

205.title: Supreme Court to look into changing abortion law to include unmarried women
205.article_body: The Supreme Court said it will interpret the Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act and the related rules to potentially allow unmarried women to terminate pregnancies up to 24 weeks. Asking the Centre to file a note by the next hearing on August 10, SC asked why unmarried women should be barred from ending pregnancies if married women are allowed.

206.title: Zerodha Founder gets query asking 'How to become a Co-founder at Zerodha?', shares pic
206.article_body: Nithin Kamath, the Founder and CEO of Zerodha, shared the screenshot of a query by a person. "Hi Zerodha, how to become a Co-founder at Zerodha?" the person asked. Sharing the screenshot, Kamath wrote, "The queries we get." After another Twitter user asked, "What's the answer?", Zerodha's Twitter handle responded, "Error processing request."

207.title: Players get mentally tired if they play back-to-back: Dhawan
207.article_body: Amid the ongoing debate on the decision to rest some of the senior Indian players from a few series, India batter Shikhar Dhawan said that players get mentally tired if they continue to play "back-to-back". "If you see there is rotation in international cricket so that players get rest. If a player travels everywhere, he will get tired," Dhawan said.

208.title: Bangladesh hikes fuel prices by record 50% amid rising inflation
208.article_body: Bangladesh on Friday raised fuel prices by around 50%, the highest price hike in the country's history, amid rising inflation. The fuel price increase was inevitable given global market conditions, the government said. "The new prices will not seem tolerable to everyone. But we had no other choice," Nasrul Hamid, the State Minister for Power, Energy and Mineral Resources, said.

209.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar elected 14th Vice-President of India
209.article_body: NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar has been elected as the 14th Vice-President of India after defeating Opposition's candidate Margaret Alva. Dhankhar, who has served as Governor of West Bengal in the past, is a lawyer by training and belongs to Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu. The term of office of M Venkaiah Naidu, Vice-President of India, is ending on August 10.

210.title: 2 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment over Dhanbad judge's murder
210.article_body: A special Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court in Jharkhand's Dhanbad on Saturday sentenced two convicts, including an autorickshaw driver, to rigorous life imprisonment till death in a case related to Additional Sessions Judge Uttam Anand's murder. The court had in July found the two guilty in the case, a year after Anand was mowed down during a morning jog.

211.title: BCCI ethics officer asks Nita Ambani to respond to conflict of interest allegations
211.article_body: BCCI ethics officer Vineet Saran has asked MI owner Nita Ambani to respond to conflict of interest allegations against her. Nita was served a notice after Saran received a complaint from MPCA member Sanjeev Gupta. Gupta alleged Nita has conflict of interest as she's also a director at Reliance Industries, which recently bought IPL digital rights through subsidiary Viacom 18.

212.title: KK's children recreate 'Yaaron' with Shaan, Papon ahead of Friendship Day
212.article_body: KK's children, Taamara and Nakul, have recreated the late singer's track 'Yaaron', along with Shaan, Papon, Benny Dayal, Dhvani Bhanushali and Leslee Lewis. Sharing a video from the recording, Taamara wrote they recorded the track at the Purple Haze Studios, where KK recorded this song around 24 years ago. "Wish dad was [here]," she added with the hashtag 'Friendship Day'.

213.title: At least 12 killed, 31 injured after Polish bus crashes in Croatia
213.article_body: A bus from Poland veered off a road and crashed near Varazdin in Croatia early on Saturday, killing at least 12 of its occupants and injuring 31 others on board, Croatian authorities said. "All the victims are Polish citizens," Poland's Foreign Ministry confirmed. The passengers were adult pilgrims headed to a Roman Catholic shrine in Bosnia, Croatia's Interior Minister informed.

214.title: Pics show parasite that enters fish's mouth, eats its tongue and then replaces it
214.article_body: Pictures show a parasite that enters a fish through its gills, eats its tongue and then replaces it. Cymothoa exigua, or the tongue-eating louse, belongs to the Cymothoidae (ectoparasite) family. After replacing the fish's tongue, it then feeds on the fish's mucus. The parasite was discovered among an import of fish in Suffolk, UK, in June.

215.title: Boxer Nikhat Zareen reaches final at CWG 2022, assures India of at least silver
215.article_body: India's 26-year-old boxer Nikhat Zareen has reached the final of the women's over 48kg-50kg (light fly) category, assuring India of at least a silver medal. Nikhat defeated 21-year-old Savannah Stubley of England in the semi-final bout. Earlier today, boxers Amit Panghal and Nitu Ghanghas also reached finals of their respective categories.

216.title: BSP MP cleared of rape charges 1 yr after complainant died due to self-immolation
216.article_body: A Varanasi court acquitted Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) MP Atul Rai in a rape case on Saturday. The 24-year-old complainant died last year after setting herself on fire outside Supreme Court alleging a delay in justice. Rai, who represents Uttar Pradesh's Ghosi constituency, will remain in jail as an abetment to suicide case is pending against him, his lawyer said.

217.title: Over 100 pigs die due to suspected African swine fever in Ranchi
217.article_body: The Jharkhand Animal Husbandry Department has sounded an alert after over 100 pigs died in Ranchi since July 27 due to suspected African swine fever, a government official said on Saturday. The department has asked all districts to take precautionary measures and follow COVID-19-like protocol in case of a similar occurrence. The department has also initiated swine fever vaccination drives.

218.title: Singer Armaan Malik dating lifestyle blogger Aashna Shroff: Report
218.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik is reportedly dating lifestyle blogger Aashna Shroff. "They were seeing each other in 2017 but then broke up. They then started dating again in 2019," Hindustan Times said quoting sources. The couple is currently in Denmark celebrating Shroff's birthday. They both took to their respective Instagram accounts to share a picture with British singer Ed Sheeran.

219.title: Indian women's 4x100m relay team qualifies for final at CWG 2022
219.article_body: Indian women's 4x100 metres relay team of Dutee Chand, Hima Das, Srabani Nanda and Jyothi Yarraji qualified for the final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Saturday. The Indian team finished second in heat one, clocking 44.45 seconds. Jamaica topped the heat with a timing of 43.66 seconds. The final will be held on Sunday.

220.title: Not party worker: BJP on Noida man booked for assaulting woman
220.article_body: BJP's Noida unit chief Manoj Gupta said Shrikant Tyagi, the man who was booked for threatening and abusing a woman following an argument with her in Noida, is "not a BJP worker". "He had come to the party some four-five years ago with Swami Prasad Maurya, who has now left the BJP. Tyagi was his disciple," Gupta further said.

221.title: Indian men's fours lawn bowls team win their first-ever medal at CWG
221.article_body: Indian men's fours lawn bowls team on Saturday created history by winning their first-ever medal at CWG. Sunil Bahadur, Navneet Singh, Chandan Kumar Singh and Dinesh Kumar bagged silver medal at CWG 2022 after losing the final against Northern Ireland team. Earlier, Indian women's fours lawn bowls team had won gold medal at CWG 2022.

222.title: Is this govt so aloof: Priyanka after CUET exam gets cancelled
222.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi criticised the BJP government after the CUET exam was called off due to alleged technical snags on Friday. "Technical snags have led to over 50,000 students being unable to take the CUET exam," Priyanka tweeted. "Is this government so aloof and insensitive to our students...Is this what the youth of our country deserves?" she asked.

223.title: Traffic curbs issued for Swatantra Bharatha Vajrotsavam event in Hyd
223.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police have issued traffic restrictions for the inaugural event of Swatantra Bharatha Vajrotsavam in Hyderabad. Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao will inaugurate the event at Hyderabad International Convention Centre on Monday. Citizens have been asked to avoid routes like Cyber Towers Junction and Alwyn-Kondapur road. The movement of heavy vehicles is restricted in certain areas.

224.title: Hamza is sick of reading online hate he's getting: Vijay on 'Darlings' role
224.article_body: Vijay Varma, taking to Instagram, dropped a few behind-the-scenes pictures from the sets of his recently released movie 'Darlings'. The actor, who plays the role of an abusive husband Hamza in the film, wrote, "Hamza is sick of reading all...online hate he's getting." Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Dil se hated your character...which shows how good you were."

225.title: Fireman called to burning home for rescue finds own kids killed in the fire in US
225.article_body: A firefighter in the US who went on a rescue operation to a burning home found that many of his own family members had been killed in the fire. Harold Baker said two of his children, his father-in-law, brother-in-law and sister-in-law were among those killed. "I tried to get in as fast as I can," said Baker after the tragedy.

226.title: 2018 silver medallist Sindhu reaches 3rd straight singles semis at CWG
226.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu reached her third straight semi-final at the Commonwealth Games on Saturday. The 2018 silver medallist defeated Jin Wei Goh of Malaysia 19-21, 21-14, 21-18 in the quarter-final. Sindhu will face Jia Min Yeo of Singapore in the semi-final on Sunday. Earlier at ongoing Commonwealth Games, Sindhu won a silver medal in mixed team event.

227.title: BJP is ruling Gujarat for 27 yrs, they've become arrogant: Kejriwal
227.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said BJP has become arrogant after ruling Gujarat for too long. "BJP is ruling Gujarat for 27 years, they've become arrogant. They don't have anything to do with people," Kejriwal said. "I being Delhi CM, met victims of 'Lattha' (spurious liquor) incident while (Gujarat) CM didn't," he stated.

228.title: Bengaluru civic body asks residents to exchange 'sub-standard' flags
228.article_body: After being accused of selling national flags of "sub-standard quality", the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has asked residents to get them exchanged with new ones. Notably, the BBMP had ordered 10 lakh national flags, to be sold at ₹22 each, under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. However, they were found to be violating the Flag Code of India 2002.

229.title: Connect 93 Gr Noida villages with sewage network: NGT to officials
229.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed authorities to connect 93 villages of Greater Noida with the sewage network to ensure no effluent spills into water bodies. The tribunal noted the villages were provided with internal drains but these were not joined with the main sewer line. NGT Chairperson Justice AK Goel said proper hygiene is imperative for a clean environment.

230.title: Fire breaks out in children's hospital in Mumbai, no one hurt
230.article_body: A fire broke out at Bai Jerbai Wadia Hospital for Children in Mumbai's Parel area on Friday evening. At the time, the operation theatre was closed and no injuries were reported. The fire brigade classified it as a 'level 2' fire and eight fire engines were sent to the scene to douse the blaze.

231.title: Flooding due to heavy rain in Senegal's capital kills at least 1
231.article_body: Flooding caused by torrential rain in Senegal's capital, Dakar, left at least one person dead and another severely injured on Friday, a police officer said. The city witnessed 126 mm of rainfall between 9 am and 3 pm on Friday. Videos showing flooded underpasses and water pouring through the windows of abandoned vehicles surfaced online.

232.title: India beat England to reach gold medal match of first-ever women's cricket event at CWG
232.article_body: India defeated England by four runs in the semi-final to reach the final of the first-ever women's cricket event at CWG. Batting first, India put up a total of 164/5 in their 20 overs, with Smriti Mandhana top-scoring with 61(32). England were restricted to 160/6 in their 20 overs. India will face either Australia or New Zealand in the final.

233.title: CWG 2022 gold medallist Sakshi Malik tears up during medal ceremony, video goes viral
233.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik, who bagged a gold medal in the women's freestyle 62 kg category at CWG 2022, teared up during the medal ceremony. In a video that has gone viral, Sakshi can be seen getting emotional as National Anthem is played in the background. Overall, Sakshi has won three medals in the history of CWG.

234.title: Over 13,000 Pune families to get COVID-19 relief funds
234.article_body: Pune's District Disaster Management Authority has sanctioned 13,338 applications for compensation to the families that lost members due to COVID-19. According to Pune Municipal Corporation's health department, 16,638 applications were received since December last year, which included several double entries. The state government has declared an ex-gratia of ₹50,000 for affected families.

235.title: New B'luru-Chennai e-way will reduce travel time to 2 hrs: Gadkari
235.article_body: The new expressway between Bengaluru and Chennai will reduce the travel time between the two cities to two hours, Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said. "India will have 26 new green expressways in the next three years and this will reduce the travel time for people choosing roadways," Gadkari said.

236.title: Gir calf born via embryo transplantation in Pune
236.article_body: A Gir calf was born using embryo transplantation technology at Mahatma Phule Krishi Vidyapeeth in Pune. University's Vice-Chancellor Prashantkumar Patil said this technology will help in preserving indigenous breeds of cattle, such as Gir. Embryo transplantation technology involves extracting the egg from a chosen female and fertilising it outside the female's body with sperm from a selected male.

237.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan to contest by-polls for 9 parliamentary seats
237.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan will contest by-elections for nine parliamentary seats on September 25, his party, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), announced on Friday. The seats had fallen vacant after PTI lawmakers' resignation in April amid a political crisis in the country. Khan was ousted from PM's post after losing a no-confidence vote.

238.title: BMC set to auction properties attached for non-payment of taxes
238.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is appointing an auction agency to sell land estates that were attached for non-payment of property taxes. The Mumbai civic body has attached over 2,800 properties with an estimated value of ₹3,047 crore in the last three years. The municipality said it is expecting tax defaulters to pay the dues once the auction begins.

239.title: T'gana CM to boycott Centre's NITI Aayog meet, cites 'bias against states'
239.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, in a letter to PM Narendra Modi, informed him of his decision to skip the NITI Aayog meeting on Sunday. "I'm staying away...as a part of...protest against the present trend of Central government to discriminate against states and not treating them as equal partners in our collective effort to make India a strong...country," Rao stated.

240.title: Abbott FreeStyle Libre aims to make glucose monitoring prick-free
240.article_body: Abbott announced the launch of FreeStyle Libre, a sensor-based monitoring device, aiming to help people with diabetes to track their glucose levels. The wearable product monitors glucose levels without fingerpricks & time spent in desired glucose range. It enables users to make informed decisions on lifestyle modification & dietary control while sharing real-time data with experts, said the brand.

241.title: Red alert in Hyd tomorrow, heavy rains expected until Tuesday: IMD
241.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert in Hyderabad for Sunday. "Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall is 75% to 100% likely to occur over north-east, north and adjoining districts of Telangana during 8 and 9 August," IMD added. As per IMD, the maximum temperature in the city is likely to be normal during the next week.

242.title: MP Raut's wife reaches ED office for questioning in Patra Chawl case
242.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's wife Varsha Raut reached the Enforcement Directorate's office in Mumbai on Saturday to record her statement in the Patra Chawl money laundering case. The ED had summoned Varsha for questioning after transactions done on her account came to light. Earlier, the agency attached assets worth ₹2 crore belonging to Varsha as part of its probe.

243.title: ED gets custody of jailed Gujarat-cadre IAS officer in bribery case
243.article_body: The ED on Friday got the custody of suspended Gujarat-cadre IAS officer K Rajesh who was arrested in July by the CBI for his alleged involvement in a bribery case. In its chargesheet, CBI had accused Rajesh of accepting bribes for issuing arms licences to ineligible people, among other charges. The ED also got custody of Rajesh's co-accused Rafiq Memon.

244.title: Sreeja Akula loses women's TT singles semi-final, to play for bronze at CWG 2022
244.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula on Saturday lost her women's table tennis singles semi-final at CWG 2022 against Singapore's Feng Tianwei. Akula lost the match with a scoreline of 6-11, 11-8, 11-6, 9-11, 8-11, 11-8, 10-12. Akula will now face Australia's Yangzi Liu in the bronze medal match tomorrow.

245.title: CUET UG 2022 exam postponed at 53 centres today amid reported glitches
245.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has postponed the CUET UG 2022 exam that was to be held at 53 centres across India on Saturday (August 6). This came amid reports of students facing glitches during Friday's exam. The postponed exam would be held between August 12 and 14 and the same admit card will be valid, NTA said.

246.title: North vs South debate doesn't exist for common cinemagoer: 'Laal...' writer
246.article_body: Actor and 'Laal Singh Chaddha' writer Atul Kulkarni said in an interview that the debate on Hindi vs South film industry "doesn't exist for common cinemagoer". "The common cinemagoer watches the film that he or she likes," he added. "And then they listen to their peers, relatives who've seen the film, and if...film is recommended and all that," said Atul.

247.title: 4 people's dictatorship is leaving no stone unturned in ruining India: Rahul
247.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the government by saying that the "dictatorship of four people is leaving no stone unturned in ruining the country". "Before exams, it is 'pariksha pe charcha'...during exams, it is 'no parcha, no charcha'...after exams, the future is dark," Rahul tweeted. He added that every youth's story is similar to what happened with the CUET candidates.

248.title: Ex-IAS officer cheated of ₹2 lakh while buying liquor online in Gurugram
248.article_body: A retired woman IAS officer from Gurugram was duped of nearly ₹2 lakh after she tried to order liquor online. "We've put the mobile number used in the fraud on surveillance and investigating. The accused will be nabbed at the earliest," a police official said. The website accessed by the victim was also used to cheat others, the police said.

249.title: Widespread rainfall warning issued for several states, IMD releases list
249.article_body: Widespread rainfall is very likely over Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh on August 6 and 7 and in Maharashtra between August 6-8. Rainfall is also very likely over West Bengal, Sikkim, Jharkhand, Odisha, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura. Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Telangana, Kerala, UP, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Rajasthan are also likely to receive rainfall.

250.title: Selfie craze can be deadly: IAS officer on video of elephants running towards tourists
250.article_body: Tamil Nadu IAS officer Supriya Sahu on Saturday tweeted a video of a pack of elephants charging towards some tourists who were posing for selfies some distance away from the animals. "Selfie craze with wildlife can be deadly," said Sahu, adding, "These people were simply lucky that these gentle giants chose to pardon their behaviour."

251.title: 2 delivery men arrested in Mumbai for changing new products with damaged ones
251.article_body: Charkop Police have arrested two delivery men of a Mumbai-based company for allegedly switching brand new products with damaged or duplicate ones. The accused Ashique Qureshi (47) and Rajkumar Yadav (30) used to return the products, by stating that customers were unavailable, at the company's godown after replacing them with damaged ones, police said.

252.title: Use the metro brother: Minister KTR to man over traffic in Hyderabad
252.article_body: During an online question-and-answer session conducted by Telangana's Minister for Municipal Administration and Urban Development KT Rama Rao (KTR), a Twitter user asked, "What are the plans to address the traffic jams on [Hyderabad's] Begumpet-Paradise stretch?" To this, KTR replied, "Use the metro brother." Criticising his reply, a user tweeted, "Sir food is expensive…[You] can drink water bro!"

253.title: Your feat will inspire millions: Prez Murmu on Priyanka's silver in race walk
253.article_body: After Priyanka Goswami became the first-ever Indian to win a silver medal in 10,000 metres race walk at Commonwealth Games on Saturday, President Droupadi Murmu congratulated her. "[By] becoming the first Indian woman to win a medal in race walking you have opened a new chapter of achievements. Your feat will inspire millions, especially our girls," she tweeted.

254.title: Alcoholic father beats 20-yr-old son to death in Thane; arrested
254.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly beating his 20-year-old son to death in Thane's Bhiwandi area. The accused, who is an alcoholic, started beating his wife up during a quarrel on the night of August 4. When the couple's two sons intervened, the accused attacked one of them with an iron rod and killed him, police said.

255.title: Indian wrestler Ravi Dahiya defeats Pakistan's Asad Ali, reaches gold medal bout
255.article_body: India's Olympic silver medal-winning wrestler Ravi Kumar Dahiya defeated Pakistan's Asad Ali in the men's freestyle 57 kg semi-final to assure India of another silver or gold medal at CWG 2022. Ravi won the bout in 3 minutes and 17 seconds. Earlier, India's Naveen also reached the final of men's 74 kg freestyle category.

256.title: Salon employee held for molesting 16-yr-old girl in Gurugram: Police
256.article_body: An employee in a salon in Gurugram's Sector 56 was arrested for allegedly molesting a 16-year-old girl during a head massage, the police said. The victim's parents had confronted the accused at the salon after being informed about the incident, they added. The accused confessed to the crime after the arrest and he was released on bail, they further said.

257.title: 2 African men apprehended in Delhi for allegedly making fake visas
257.article_body: Two African men were apprehended in Delhi's outer district area after they were allegedly caught making fake Indian visas during a police raid, officials informed. They were also found in possession of a laptop with blank formats of Indian visas and other suspicious files, police said. The duo allegedly admitted to making fake visas for their own passports.

258.title: Centre writes to Delhi & 6 states over rise in COVID-19 cases, list released
258.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to six states and one Union Territory over a rise in COVID-19 cases there, advising them to ramp up testing and vaccination. Delhi, Kerala, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and Telangana have received the advisory from Central Government. Delhi on Friday recorded 2,419 new COVID-19 cases, marking a six-month high.

259.title: Homeless man arrested for killing 20-yr-old aspiring singer in Versova
259.article_body: Days after a 20-year-old aspiring singer, Suraj Tiwari, was killed with a paver block at a bus stop in Mumbai's Versova, police arrested a man named Monu for the crime. According to police, Suraj and Monu, who lived on the streets of Andheri, were friends and would do drugs together. Monu killed Suraj following a fight, police added.

260.title: Govindas participating in Dahi Handi to get free insurance cover
260.article_body: While BJP announced ₹10 lakh insurance cover for Govindas participating in the Dahi Handi festival in Mumbai this year, MNS said it'll be giving insurance cover of ₹100 crore for 1000 Govindas for free. "Every year, many Govindas suffer serious injuries or lose their lives during the festival," a BJP leader said, adding that nobody pays attention to their sufferings.

261.title: Australia should be prudent on Taiwan-related issues: Chinese embassy
261.article_body: China hopes that Australia will be prudent on Taiwan-related issues and "not follow certain countries' strategy of containing China with Taiwan and...create new troubles...in China-Australia relations", the Chinese Embassy in Australia said. The comments came after US, Australia and Japan released a joint statement expressing concerns over China's recent military exercises in the Taiwan Strait.

262.title: Armaan meets Ed Sheeran, says 'Truly an emotional evening for me'
262.article_body: Singer-songwriter Armaan Malik took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with Ed Sheeran. Armaan, who had collaborated with the British singer for a song, wrote, "Truly an emotional evening for me." "From doing a song with @EdSheeran to finally meeting him [and] talking about music and life...Thank you Ed for being so warm and humble," he added.

263.title: 40-yr-old Sharath beats 16-yr-old Quek to enter men's TT singles semis at CWG
263.article_body: Indian paddler Sharath Kamal reached the men's singles semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Saturday. The 40-year-old beat 16-year-old Yong Izaac Quek of Singapore 11-6, 11-7, 11-4, 11-7 in the quarter-final. Sharath will face Paul Drinkhall of England in the semi-final on Sunday. Earlier, Sharath also reached semi-finals of mixed doubles and men's doubles in Birmingham.

264.title: Could've made comeback 2-3 weeks ago, played in T20Is vs WI: Chahar
264.article_body: India pacer Deepak Chahar, who hasn't played since February 2022 after suffering a hamstring injury, revealed that he could've made his comeback two-three weeks ago. "I could've played...T20I series against West Indies. But then, my thought process was that whenever you play, you give your 110%," he added. Chahar has been included in India's 15-member squad for upcoming Zimbabwe tour.

265.title: Villager killed by maoists on suspicion of being police informer in MP
265.article_body: Maoists allegedly killed a villager on suspicion of being a police informer in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district, police said on Saturday. The maoists reportedly took the body away with them. According to reports, a note was recovered from the spot wherein Communist Party of India (Maoist) took responsibility for the death and warned police against converting local people into informers.

266.title: India's forex reserves rise by $2.4 billion after 4-week fall
266.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves rose by nearly $2.4 billion to $573.9 billion during the week ending July 29, according to the Reserve Bank of India's weekly supplementary statistical data. The rise was led by positive inflows by foreign investors in the Indian equity market. It had been witnessing a fall for four consecutive weeks prior to that.

267.title: World's most powerful telescope spots most distant galaxy ever seen, pic released
267.article_body: University of Edinburgh scientists said they've used the world's most powerful telescope, NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, to spot the most distant galaxy ever observed by mankind. The galaxy CEERS-93316 is located 35 billion light-years away, researchers said. Last month, the galaxy GLASS-z13, located 33 billion light-years away, had broken the record of the farthest galaxy ever observed.

268.title: Don't want people to be part of my grief: Ketki on working after Rasik's death
268.article_body: Actress Ketki Dave in an interview revealed that she resumed work two days after her actor-husband Rasik Dave's death. She said that she doesn't want people to be a part of her grief. People should be included in one's happiness, Ketki added. Rasik passed away in Mumbai at the age of 65 after suffering kidney failure.

269.title: Fans of Vijay distribute free food in Coimbatore to marks 30 yrs of Ajith
269.article_body: Fans of actors Vijay and Ajith Kumar recently came together to serve free food to the poor in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore to celebrate Ajith's 30 years in the industry. As per reports, Vijay and Ajith are considered to be on-screen rivals and their fans are also known rivals. Pictures of the event celebrating Ajith went viral on social media.

270.title: 'Piku' was a beautiful collaboration with Big B, Irrfan: Deepika
270.article_body: Speaking about her 2015 film 'Piku', actress Deepika Padukone stated that it was a "beautiful collaborative process" with Amitabh Bachchan and late actor Irrfan Khan. She further said that all three of them were "really genuinely invested in telling a good story". The actress added that she is at an age where she is Piku and it's her favourite character.

271.title: Pooja Gehlot, Vinesh Phogat enter semi-finals in wrestling at CWG 2022
271.article_body: Wrestlers Pooja Gehlot and Vinesh Phogat entered the semi-finals of the 50-kg category and 53-kg category respectively, at CWG 2022. Pooja defeated Christelle Letchidjio 12-2, going on to enter the semi-finals after her opening match against Cameroon's Rebecca Ndolo was forfeited. Vinesh beat Canada's Samantha Stewart in her opening match via fall by 2-0, further defeating Mercy Adekuoroye 6-0.

272.title: Burn vehicles: K'taka MLA to people being stopped from destroying trees
272.article_body: Karnataka legislator from Janata Dal (Secular), Suresh Gowda, allegedly abused forest officers and issued threats to burn their vehicles. In a video that reportedly went viral, he can be seen abusing and threatening forest staff who restrained people from destroying trees on a forest land. "You...all set forest vehicles on fire...Rest, I will take care," the MLA reportedly said.

273.title: US dollar gains after payrolls report shows job growth in July
273.article_body: The US dollar recorded its biggest daily percentage gain since mid-June against the yen on Friday and rallied across the board. The US dollar was up 1.3% against the yen for the week. The dollar index extended gains following a US payrolls report that showed non-farm payrolls surged by 5,28,000 jobs in July, which is the largest gain since February.

274.title: US adds 5,28,000 jobs in July, unemployment rate declines to 3.5%
274.article_body: US employers hired more workers than expected in July with non-farm payrolls adding 5,28,000 jobs, the US Labor Department's report showed. This led the unemployment rate to decline to a pre-pandemic low of 3.5% from 3.6% in June. All the 2.20 crore jobs lost in March and April 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic in the US have reportedly been recovered.

275.title: Sable becomes first-ever Indian to win a medal in 3,000m steeplechase at CWG
275.article_body: Avinash Sable has become the first-ever Indian athlete to win a medal in 3,000m steeplechase event at CWG. The 27-year-old clocked 8:11.20, his personal best timing, to bag the silver medal in men's 3,000m steeplechase event at CWG 2022. He missed out on a gold medal by a margin of 0.05 seconds. Kenya's Abraham Kibiwot bagged gold by clocking 8:11.15.

276.title: Centre directs Maharashtra to ramp up COVID-19 testing
276.article_body: Amid surge in daily COVID-19 cases, the Centre has directed Maharashtra government to ramp up testing and vaccination drive. The state has been reporting high average daily cases for past one month (2,135 average cases/day). "State is advised to diligently follow five-fold strategy, i.e. test, track, treat, vaccinate and adherence to COVID appropriate behaviour," letter from Health Ministry read.

277.title: Locals involved in murder of BJP youth leader: K'taka Home Minister
277.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Saturday said the killers of BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru were locals and not from Kerala. He further claimed that the killers are from Dakshina Kannada district and will be arrested in two or three days. This comes after CM Basavaraj Bommai decided to hand over the case to NIA, citing an "inter-state link".

278.title: 1,400 flights cancelled as thunderstorms hit US East Coast
278.article_body: Nearly 1,400 flights in the US were cancelled and 6,300 flights were delayed on Friday after thunderstorms hit the East Coast, according to tracking service FlightAware. Most cancellations were recorded at the three major airports in the New York City area and Reagan National Airport outside Washington, DC. About 250 flights each were cancelled by American Airlines and Republic Airways.

279.title: YouTuber breaks Guinness World Record by doing 25 pull-ups hanging from a helicopter
279.article_body: The most pull-ups from a helicopter in one minute is 25, and was achieved by Stan Bruininck (Netherlands) at Hoevenen Airfield in Antwerp, Belgium, on July 6. Bruininck is a fitness enthusiast specialising in calisthenics. He is one of the presenters of the YouTube channel 'Browney'. The number to beat was 23 pull-ups, previously achieved by Roman Sahradyan (Armenia).

280.title: We only want to help: Binance CEO on his 'fight' with WazirX Co-founder on Twitter
280.article_body: Amid WazirX Co-founder Nischal Shetty and Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao's argument on Twitter over the latter owning equity in the former's cryptocurrency trading platform, a Twitter user asked Zhao why they were fighting. Zhao replied, "Not us fighting. ED investigating WazirX. We only want to help." While Shetty asserted that Binance acquired WazirX, Zhao said the transaction was never completed.

281.title: Not even Superman can fix crisis in Myanmar, says ASEAN envoy
281.article_body: Prak Sokhonn, a special envoy from the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), on Saturday said that even Superman cannot solve the crisis in Myanmar. Sokhonn has made two trips to Myanmar since the coup. "Negotiation takes years...After two visits of the special envoy, two visits only, some people start to lose patience and ask for results," he added.

282.title: 18 people including 3 kids fall ill after consuming 'prasad' in Assam
282.article_body: As many as 18 people, including three children, were hospitalised as they fell sick after consuming 'prasad' at a religious function in Assam's Majuli district. The people reportedly complained of stomach aches and vomiting right after consuming the 'prasad'. "Their health condition is now stable. We suspect...it's a case of food poisoning," a doctor from the district hospital said.

283.title: School students in Delhi, TN make rakhis for Army jawans
283.article_body: Students of various schools in Delhi and Tamil Nadu on Saturday presented self-made rakhis to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh for the soldiers protecting the borders. "As the Defence Minister of the country, I assure you that I myself will give these rakhis to the three service chiefs so that these can reach jawans of all the three services," said Singh.

284.title: I guarantee Prabhas' Project K will change Indian cinema, can't wait: Dulquer
284.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said that he guarantees that actor Prabhas' 'Project K' is going to change Indian cinema forever. "I know everybody is dying to know about 'Project K'. I had the good fortune of just peeping into the sets...I don't think anybody's thinking the way Nagi is...I can't wait. I know none of you can," he added.

285.title: Amnesty Int'l Ukraine chief quits over Russia 'propaganda' report
285.article_body: The head of Amnesty International in Ukraine resigned after the group accused Ukrainian forces of endangering civilians by basing troops in residential areas. Oksana Pokalchuk said the report "became a tool of Russian propaganda". "If you don't live in a country that's been invaded by invaders...you probably won't understand what it is like to condemn the defence army," Pokalchuk added.

286.title: IIT Guwahati completely resumes classes in offline mode
286.article_body: IIT Guwahati has resumed its classes in complete offline mode. "More than 7,400 students have attended classes in classrooms with the batch admitted during the pandemic attending full-semester classes in person for the first time," IIT Guwahati said in an official statement. It added that the institute will have over 8,700 students on campus by November 2022.

287.title: 17 lakh National Flags to be distributed in Thane
287.article_body: Under the Centre's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, 17 lakh National Flags will be distributed in Thane district of Maharashtra for hoisting ahead of India's 75th Independence Day. A total of 80,000 students have been appointed as 'Tiranga ambassadors' to spread the message. "There is a plan is to hoist 17 lakh flags [across the district]," said Collector of Thane.

288.title: I had to give Akshay an actual tight slap for a scene: Katrina on Sooryavanshi
288.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said she had to give an "actual tight slap" on Akshay Kumar's face for a scene in 'Sooryavanshi'. "I was hesitating," added Katrina. "It reminded me of the time...when Akshay and I were shooting for...'Welcome'. It was like having a deja vu," she stated. "Shooting for a Rohit Shetty film is a whole different experience," said Katrina.

289.title: Pune civic body invites project suggestions from citizens up to ₹5 lakh
289.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has started participatory budgeting (PB) and invited citizens to suggest projects of up to ₹5 lakh that can be included in the corporation's 2023-2024 budget. "This process empowers citizens to propose innovative projects and solutions for their communities and neighbourhoods," PMC said. "Since 2006-07, Pune has pioneered the process of PB in India," it added.

290.title: Ask wives how're they running kitchen: AIUDF chief to BJP MPs on inflation
290.article_body: Reacting to inflation, All India United Democratic Front chief Badruddin Ajmal criticised Finance Minister for hampering progress of the nation. He questioned Nirmala Sitharaman for her way of handling economy. "India's money is with Sitharaman...BJP MPs should ask their wives how're they running the kitchen. Centre should take note otherwise inflation will end their rule in 2024," said Ajmal.

291.title: New Parliament building likely to be ready by November: MoS Kishore
291.article_body: Union Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore informed the Lok Sabha that the new Parliament building is likely to be ready by November 2022 as its construction is 70% complete. The Vice President's enclave is expected to be ready by January 2023, he said, adding that work on the revamped Central Vista Avenue is nearly complete.

292.title: Not every story can be about a woman finding the agency: Imtiaz Ali
292.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali stated that he feels fascinated by women for having been in a more repressed and disadvantaged role than men yet having a smile on their faces. He added that his 2014 film 'Highway and web series 'She' are about women finding their agency. "[But] not every story can be about a woman finding the agency," Imtiaz said.

293.title: Lone Wolf is ready: Dhanush confirms being part of 'The Gray Man' sequel
293.article_body: Actor Dhanush took to Twitter on Saturday to confirm his return as assassin Avik San alias Lone Wolf in the Russo Brothers' directorial 'The Gray Man' sequel. He tweeted, "The Gray Man universe is expanding and the sequel is coming...Lone Wolf is ready, are you?" Netflix recently announced that the film will have a sequel as well as a spin-off.

294.title: Expedite repatriation of fishermen stranded in Oman: Stalin to EAM
294.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday wrote a letter to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar asking him to expedite the repatriation of eight fishermen from Kanniyakumari who're stranded in Oman's capital city Muscat. He said that the fishermen are stranded there due to the "expiry of their visa and non-payment of salary...by Oman national under whom they were working".

295.title: Priyanka creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win CWG silver in 10,000m race walk
295.article_body: Athlete Priyanka Goswami has created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a silver medal in 10,000m race walk at CWG. The 26-year-old clocked 43:38.83 to finish second in women's 10,000m race walk final at CWG 2022. It is India's third athletics medal at CWG 2022 after long jumper Murali Sreeshankar's silver and high jumper Tejaswin Shankar's bronze medal.

296.title: Fully cooperating with ED but don't agree with their claims: WazirX amid probe
296.article_body: WazirX on Saturday tweeted that they are fully cooperating with the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and have responded to their queries fully. However, it said, "We do not agree with the allegations in the ED press release." ED has accused WazirX of assisting Chinese instant loan app companies in laundering fraud money via the purchase and transfer of cryptocurrency.

297.title: My vision for 'Brahmāstra' began while writing 'Yeh Jawaani...' script: Ayan
297.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has stated that his vision for the upcoming film 'Brahmāstra' began in 2011 while he was working on the script of 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani' in Shimla. The filmmaker further said that he dreamt of telling a story that is rooted in Indian culture and mythology but is presented to the audience using modern technology.

298.title: Guj CM launches scheme to promote use of drones in agriculture sector
298.article_body: Gujarat government has launched Nano Urea Spraying Scheme in Isanpur Mota village of Gandhinagar district. It aims to promote the use of drones in the agriculture sector. "The use of drones in spraying the...urea will cut down the agricultural cost substantially which will increase the income of the farmers...It will also save water," said CM Bhupendra Patel.

299.title: Bengaluru Police bust fake stamp paper racket, 11 arrested
299.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested 11 people after busting a fake stamp paper racket on Friday. The accused were allegedly printing and selling the banned stamp papers on the premises of Kandaya Bhavan, police said. Fake stamp papers of various denominations worth ₹5 lakh were recovered. Notably, a head constable was sent as a decoy to bust the racket.

300.title: Delhi Directorate of Education serves termination notice to 72 teachers
300.article_body: Manish Sisodia-led Delhi Directorate of Education (DoE) has served termination notice to 72 government school teachers. This comes after it was found that there was a mismatch between the biometrics and photographs submitted by them during the 2018 Delhi Subordinate Services Selection Board (DSSSB) exam. DoE said other people had appeared in the exam in place of the actual candidates.

301.title: I bought an EV after this: Jairam Ramesh on video of exchange with Gadkari
301.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh on Saturday shared a video of a recent Rajya Sabha exchange with Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari, saying, "After this exchange...I got myself a Tata Nexon electric vehicle (EV)." Ramesh had asked Gadkari if the government had a roadmap to phase out petrol and diesel vehicles. Gadkari had talked about government's scrapping policy.

302.title: Booster dose is must for all: LNJP doctor on rising COVID cases in Delhi
302.article_body: Raising concern over the rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi, Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital MD Dr Suresh Kumar on Saturday said it's necessary for all to take the booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine. "Positivity rate has gone up along with hospitalisation," he said. "People need to be alert, especially those...who are already suffering from serious diseases," Kumar added.

303.title: Canada urges China to halt its 'coercive' military actions around Taiwan
303.article_body: Canadian Foreign Minister Affairs Mélanie Joly urged China to halt "its coercive military and economic actions" around Taiwan over US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taipei visit. "Canada is deeply concerned by the missiles launched by the People's Republic of China towards Taiwan and into Japan's exclusive economic zone," she said, adding, "This action threatens regional stability and security."

304.title: Sri Lanka's economic woes would last another year: Prez
304.article_body: Speaking at a conference, Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday said that the country's economic woes would last for another year. Sri Lanka will have to look at new sectors such as logistics and nuclear energy for its economic recovery, he added. "We have to think outside the box," Wickremesinghe further said.

305.title: Indian boxer Amit Panghal reaches final at CWG for 2nd straight time
305.article_body: Indian boxer Amit Panghal on Saturday reached the gold medal bout at CWG 2022 in Birmingham by defeating Zambian boxer Patrick Chinyemba in the semi-final of the men's over 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category. It is the second straight time that Amit has reached the final at CWG. He had bagged silver medal at CWG 2018 in Gold Coast.

306.title: Top Russian hypersonic missile scientist arrested on high treason charges
306.article_body: A prominent Russian scientist involved with the development of hypersonic missiles has been arrested on high treason charges, according to TASS news agency. Alexander Shiplyuk was detained in the Siberian city of Novosibirsk and has been taken to Moscow's Lefortovo pre-trial detention centre. He is the third Russian scientist this summer to be arrested on suspicion of treason.

307.title: Thinking about you: Marvel chief to Batgirl makers after film's cancellation
307.article_body: Marvel Studios chief Kevin Feige sent a message to directors Adil El Arbi and Bilall Fallah following the cancellation of their film 'Batgirl'. Adil, who learned about the cancellation during his wedding, shared an email from Feige, which read, "My friends, we're all thinking about you both. Because of the wonderful news about...wedding (congrats!) and the disappointing news about 'Batgirl'."

308.title: Defending champion Manika crashes out in women's TT singles quarters at CWG
308.article_body: Defending champion Manika Batra crashed out in the quarter-final of women's singles table tennis event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Friday. Singapore's Jian Zeng beat Manika 4-0. The 27-year-old lost with a scoreline of 10-12, 9-11, 4-11, 7-11. Manika also lost in the quarter-final of mixed doubles. She and her partner Sathiyan Gnanasekaran were beaten 3-2.

309.title: Google launches 'India ki Udaan' to mark 75 years of Independence
309.article_body: Google has collaborated with the Ministry of Culture to launch the 'India ki Udaan' project to commemorate 75 years of India's Independence and celebrate the milestones the country has achieved over these years. The project will use rich archives and feature artistic illustrations to tell the story of India. It also announced the Doodle4Google contest for 2022 on Friday.

310.title: 2 assaulted in Gurugram for asking neighbours to keep dog on leash
310.article_body: A 52-year-old man and his son were allegedly assaulted in Gurugram's Pataudi on July 15 for asking a neighbouring family to keep their dog on leash, police said. The duo from Baspadamka village approached the police on Thursday after recovering from their injuries, police added. They have accused their neighbours of attacking them with sharp-edged weapons, rods and bricks.

311.title: Aamir video called me, I was shocked: Naga on getting Laal Singh Chaddha role
311.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya said that he got a video call from actor Aamir Khan before he got a role in the movie 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "I was shocked because I don't get a video call from an actor like Mr Aamir Khan very often...Aamir sir...wanted me to hear the script...it went up till 1:30-2:00 am," Naga added.

312.title: Nykaa to acquire digital lifestyle platform Little Black Book
312.article_body: Nykaa's parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures will acquire a 100% stake in Iluminar Media, known as Little Black Book (LBB), a digital lifestyle discovery platform. The transaction, whose sum is yet undisclosed, is expected to be completed within 60 days of execution. "LBB's focus on fashion, home and beauty categories fits well with Nykaa’s areas of strength,” Nykaa said.

313.title: Hyderabad's Sunday-Funday festivities to restart from August 14
313.article_body: On being asked about Sunday-Funday festivities at Hyderabad's Tank Bund on Twitter, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Friday tweeted that they'll be restarted soon and tagged state special chief secretary Arvind Kumar asking him to heed the suggestion. Following this, Kumar replied saying that the festivities be restarted from August 14 onwards. Earlier, festivities were shut down amid COVID-19.

314.title: Illegal sand mining racket busted at Mutha riverbed in Pune
314.article_body: A team of Pune district officials, along with the police, busted an illegal sand mining racket at the Mutha riverbed in Shivane. They seized a JCB machine and a tractor with an attached sand mining filter net from the spot. "We suspect someone from...government team is also involved in the racket," an activist who complained about the illegal mining said.

315.title: Neeraj Chopra is my brother, I miss him here: Pak javelin thrower Arshad on CWG 2022
315.article_body: Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem said he will miss competing against Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra at CWG 2022. "Neeraj bhai is my brother. I miss him here. May God give him the best of health and I get to compete with him soon," he said. "We have a very good friendship...We are like one family," Arshad added.

316.title: Voicing opinion, protesting is 'illegal' in our country: Rahul Gandhi
316.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while reacting to FIRs filed against his party leaders for holding nationwide protests, said voicing opinions and protesting are considered "illegal" in our country. "They [BJP govt] can do whatever they want," Rahul added. Several Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Shashi Tharoor, were detained on Friday for protesting over inflation and unemployment.

317.title: 3 brothers get 10-year jail term for raping minor in UP's Sultanpur
317.article_body: A local court in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur district sentenced three brothers to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment each for raping a minor girl. The case dates back to 2010 when the then 14-year-old girl had set herself on fire after alleging being raped by the accused for a month. The accused had also reportedly threatened to push her into prostitution.

318.title: SBI's Q1 net profit falls 6.7% to ₹6,068 crore, NII rises 12.87%
318.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) reported a 6.7% year-on-year fall in net profit for the quarter ended June to ₹6,068.08 crore as against ₹6,504 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The bank's net interest income (NII) stood at ₹31,196 crore, which is a 12.87% year-on-year jump compared to ₹27,638 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

319.title: WazirX didn't cooperate with us, seems uncooperative with ED as well: Binance CEO
319.article_body: Amid a row over Indian cryptocurrency exchange WazirX's ownership, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said Binance had asked WazirX to transfer their system source code, deployment and operations in February but the latter refused to do so. "WazirX has been uncooperative with us and looks like uncooperative with ED as well," said Zhao. ED is investigating WazirX transactions worth ₹2,790 crore.

320.title: I am 'needy' and 'sensitive' just like her: Janhvi on mother Sridevi
320.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she is "needy" and "sensitive" just like her late mother and actress Sridevi. "I cry like her...I walk like her...Apparently, the sounds I make when I eat food are exactly like her...My voice is very similar to hers," added Janhvi. Janhvi had earlier stated that her life with Sridevi was a fantasy.

321.title: War in Ukraine set to enter new phase: UK military intelligence
321.article_body: The war in Ukraine is set to enter a new phase, British military intelligence said. "Russian forces are almost certainly amassing in the south of Ukraine, anticipating a counter-offensive or in preparation for a possible assault," it added. Long convoys of military trucks, tanks and towed artillery are moving southwest away from Donbas region in eastern Ukraine, it further said.

322.title: PMC to provide nutritional support to 3,000 tuberculosis patients
322.article_body: The health department of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has identified 3,000 tuberculosis (TB) patients and will provide them with nutritional support under the central government's 'End TB by 2025' campaign. A PMC TB officer said that each patient is provided at least ₹500 per month for nutrition, however, patients need flour, fruits, eggs and milk monthly which amounts to ₹1,050.

323.title: India announce their playing XI for CWG women's cricket semi-final against England
323.article_body: India captain Harmanpreet Kaur won the toss and elected to bat first against England in the women's T20I cricket semi-final at CWG 2022. India are playing an unchanged XI. India had qualified for the semi-finals after finishing second in their group. Australia will face New Zealand in the second semi-final tonight.

324.title: Noida Authority fined ₹100 cr, Delhi Jal Board ₹50 cr for polluting rivers
324.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) has fined Noida Authority ₹100 crore and Delhi Jal Board ₹50 crore for discharging untreated water into drains that eventually meet Yamuna and Ganga. The fines are an interim compensation to be utilised for restoration measures in terms of a remedial plan, NGT stated. It directed the Chief Secretaries of both states to identify erring officials.

325.title: 21-year-old Indian boxer Nitu reaches gold medal bout in her first-ever CWG
325.article_body: India's 21-year-old boxer Nitu Ghanghas has reached the gold medal bout in the women's minimumweight (45kg to 48kg) category at CWG 2022. Nitu, who is featuring in her first-ever CWG, defeated Canada's Priyanka Dhillon in the semi-final. Notably, Nitu is a two-time world youth champion in women's light flyweight (48kg) category.

326.title: Sing national anthem while holding Tiranga on August 14: Delhi CM Kejriwal
326.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has urged people to sing the national anthem while holding a Tiranga in hands at 5 pm on August 14 to celebrate 75 years of independence. AAP government has decided to distribute 25 lakh flags across the national capital. "We...must come together and pledge to make India the number one country in the world," Kejriwal said.

327.title: 23-yr-old McDonald's worker who was shot over cold french fries in US dies
327.article_body: The Brooklyn McDonald's worker shot point-blank in a spat over cold french fries has died, police said on Friday. Matthew Webb, 23, succumbed to his injuries after he was shot on Monday outside the Bedford-Stuyvesant fast food restaurant where he worked, the NYPD said. The suspect, Michael Morgan, 20, is expected to be charged with murder.

328.title: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Manmohan Singh & others cast votes for VP polls
328.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived at the Parliament on Saturday to cast his vote for the Vice-Presidential elections. Union ministers Amit Shah, Nirmala Sitharaman, Nitin Gadkari, Rajnath Singh and Dharmendra Pradhan also cast their votes. Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh arrived at the Parliament in a wheelchair to vote. Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi have also voted.

329.title: Team management was unfair, he was unnecessarily played: Hafeez on Hassan
329.article_body: Reacting to Pakistani pacer Hassan Ali not being picked for the Asia Cup 2022, ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez said Hassan was "unfairly" asked to play matches where he could've been rested. "Mentally, he wasn't ready for that pressure," added Hafeez. Hafeez stated that Hassan needs a break just like Virat Kohli who has been facing too much mental pressure.

330.title: Taiwan official leading missile production died of heart attack: Report
330.article_body: The 57-year-old Taiwanese official supervising missile production projects who was found dead at a hotel on Saturday was killed by a heart attack, local media reported quoting authorities. Ou Yang Li-hsing had a history of heart disease and had a cardiac stent, the report quoted his family as saying. His death comes amid heightened tensions with China.

331.title: Riders stuck vertically 160 ft up in air after rollercoaster malfunctions in Spain
331.article_body: At least 10 people were stuck after the rollercoaster ride they were on board suffered a malfunction, causing the riders to be trapped vertically at a height of 160 feet in a theme park in Madrid, Spain. A technical failure caused the riders to be stranded on the ride for over an hour before they were safely evacuated.

332.title: Tesla will do well even if I am kidnapped by aliens or return to my home planet: Musk
332.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk recently said, "I think Tesla...would continue to do very well even if I was kidnapped by aliens, or went back to my home planet." He was responding to a question during the company's 2022 shareholders' meeting about whether he would ever leave his role as CEO of Tesla. "I'm not leaving, to be clear," Musk clarified.

333.title: Debris from 1968 plane crash found on Swiss glacier
333.article_body: Wreckage from a plane that crashed in the Swiss Alps in 1968 has been discovered on a glacier on Thursday, police said. The debris from the plane was reportedly discovered on the Aletsch Glacier by a mountain guide during an expedition. Three people were killed on June 30, 1968, plane crash and all their bodies were discovered at that time.

334.title: If Twitter provides proof of real accounts, deal will proceed on original terms: Musk
334.article_body: Elon Musk said the $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter will "proceed on original terms", if Twitter provides its method of sampling 100 accounts and how they are confirmed to be real. "If it turns out that their SEC filings are materially false, then it shouldn't," Musk added. Currently, Twitter and Musk are involved in a legal battle over the acquisition.

335.title: Ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray returns as editor of Saamana
335.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray has returned as the editor of the party's mouthpiece Saamana after stepping down from the post of CM of Maharashtra. The print line of the Marathi newspaper published Uddhav's name as editor and party MP Sanjay Raut's name as executive editor on Friday. In 2019, Uddhav left the editor post when he became state CM.

336.title: GHMC begins appointing consultants for 4 bridges across Musi river
336.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has initiated the process of appointing consultants for constructing four bridges across Musi river. "The main objective of appointing a consulting firm was to work out...most cost-effective solution with innovative...construction technologies," a GHMC official said. The bridges will be built at Ibrahimbagh, Moosarambagh, Chaderghat and Attapur.

337.title: Khloé Kardashian welcomes second child with Tristan Thompson via surrogacy
337.article_body: American television personality Khloé Kardashian has welcomed her second child with ex-boyfriend basketball player Tristan Thompson via surrogacy. The former couple has a four-year-old daughter together named True Thompson. Khloé and Tristan started dating in 2016 and welcomed True in 2018. They split in June 2021 before reuniting and last broke up in January this year.

338.title: I am happy being single, I am lonely at times: Janhvi Kapoor
338.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor stated in an interview that she is happy being single, adding she is lonely at times. "Being lonely is a consequence of my past experiences than who I am right now," the actress added. Janhvi further stated that she is guarding herself, adding she has wasted too much of her energy on people who don't deserve it.

339.title: Instagram to test ultra-tall photos that fill entire screen soon
339.article_body: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri said the social media platform will start testing ultra-tall photos that fill entire screen "in a week or two". "You can have tall videos, but you cannot have tall photos on Instagram. So we thought...we should make sure that we treat both equally," Mosseri stated. Instagram intends to support displaying pictures in a 9:16 frame.

340.title: Mark Zuckerberg's custom-made 1992 baseball card to be sold as NFT
340.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday shared pictures of a custom-made 1992 baseball card on Instagram that'll be sold as an NFT. The card features eight-year-old Zuckerberg and lists his batting average as 0.920. He had signed the card back then and had given it to his camp counsellor, said online collectible retailer Comic Connect, which will auction the NFT.

341.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia seeks CBI probe into ex-LG's change of stance on liquor policy
341.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that he has written to the CBI seeking a probe into former Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal's change of stance on opening of liquor shops in unauthorised areas. "The cabinet's policy was earlier cleared by former LG, but the decision was later revoked. This led to losses worth thousands of crores," Sisodia claimed.

342.title: FIH apologises for clock controversy in shootout during India's women's hockey semi loss
342.article_body: International Hockey Federation (FIH) apologised for the clock controversy in shootout during India's CWG women's hockey semi-final loss against Australia. "Shootout started mistakenly too early (clock wasn't yet ready to operate), for which we apologise," it said. FIH added it'll "thoroughly review" the incident. Australia, who missed their first penalty, were asked to retake it due to the error.

343.title: Video showing bull travelling on passenger train in Jharkhand goes viral
343.article_body: A video showing a bull travelling on a passenger train going from Sahibganj in Jharkhand to Bihar has gone viral on social media. About 10-12 people boarded the bull on the train, tied it to a seat, and left, according to reports. Reacting to the video, a social media user wrote, "Incredible India."

344.title: Such bias was in cricket too: Sehwag on controversial shootout in women's hockey semi
344.article_body: Reacting to India losing to Australia in CWG women's hockey semi-final after a controversial penalty shootout, Virender Sehwag said, "Penalty miss hua Australia se and...umpire says, 'Sorry clock hasn't started'. Wah bhai wah...Hadd hai." He added, "Such bias...used to happen in cricket [too] earlier till we became...superpower...Hockey mein bhi hum jald banenge and all clocks will start on time."

345.title: With parents in jail, HC tells Delhi Police to get girl admitted to school
345.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the city police to get an eight-year-old girl admitted to a school since her parents have been in jail in connection with a murder case since 2021. The court reportedly said the child must get admitted to school at earliest so that shadow of no unpleasant happening falls upon her to darken her future.

346.title: US summons Chinese ambassador over "irresponsible" Taiwan actions
346.article_body: The US summoned China's ambassador to White House to condemn China's "irresponsible" military activities near Taiwan. "We made clear to [the envoy] that...US is prepared for what Beijing chooses to do," White House National Security spokesperson John Kirby said. China began its largest-ever military drills around Taiwan on Thursday, a day after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited the island.

347.title: Karnataka CM tests COVID-19 positive, cancels Delhi trip
347.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday tested positive for COVID-19 with mild symptoms. "Those who came in touch with me in the last few days, kindly isolate yourself and get yourself tested. My trip to Delhi stands cancelled," Bommai tweeted. He was to travel to New Delhi today to participate in the third meeting of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

348.title: Woman jumps in well with 4 kids in Raj; kids die, woman survives
348.article_body: A 32-year-old woman jumped into a well along with her four children following a family dispute in Rajasthan's Ajmer, police said on Saturday.
