All of the children, including the youngest who was one-month-old, died in the incident while the mother was pulled out alive, police added. No case has been filed so far, however, an investigation is underway, SHO said.

349.title: Myanmar military rulers banned from ASEAN until peace plan progress
349.article_body: Myanmar's military rulers have been barred from attending the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) meetings until they make progress on a 15-month-old plan to address the crisis triggered by the military coup. The coup prompted a mass civil disobedience movement, protests and the formation of anti-coup armed groups in Myanmar. The military has also been accused of extrajudicial killings.

350.title: 18, including children, injured as mini-bus falls into gorge in J&K
350.article_body: At least 18 people, including children, were injured when a mini-bus plunged into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district, officials said. The incident took place on Saturday morning when the bus was on its way from Barmeen to Udhampur. All injured were rushed to the hospital, officials said, adding that many of them were said to be serious.

351.title: Leave 'sarkari' attitude & perform or be ready to pack up: Vaishnaw to BSNL staff
351.article_body: In a meeting with senior management of BSNL, Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw asked employees to let go of 'sarkari' attitude and those who are not performing as per expectations, will be asked to compulsorily retire. He added, "You have to perform the best or be ready to pack up and go home...This will be the new normal- perform or perish."

352.title: Spurious liquor claims 13 lives in Bihar’s Chapra
352.article_body: At least 13 people have died after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's Chapra district (Saran) in last two days. Eleven people are currently being treated at the PMC Hospital, while 15 others who had consumed alcohol have lost their sight. Several women protested against the police on Chapra highway and demanded that the responsible officers be held accountable.

353.title: I wish I had worked on my power-hitting earlier in my career: Karthik
353.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he wishes he had worked on his power-hitting earlier in his career, adding that he has worked a lot on it. Karthik stated he's extremely happy with the backing provided by Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Team India head coach Rahul Dravid. "This is what I have aimed for all my life," he said.

354.title: He has all this money & still wears same clothes: Meta's AI chatbot on Zuckerberg
354.article_body: Meta has unveiled an AI chatbot that can search the internet to chat about any topic. After a Twitter user asked the chatbot about its feelings on Mark Zuckerberg as Facebook CEO, it replied, "He is a good businessman, but his business practices are not always ethical. It is funny...he has all this money and still wears the same clothes!"

355.title: Seer dies by suicide in Raj over land dispute, blames BJP MLA in note
355.article_body: A 60-year-old seer, identified as Ravinath, allegedly died by suicide in Rajasthan and blamed Bhinmal BJP MLA Pooraram Choudhary in a note, police said. He was found hanging from a tree at Jalore's Rajpura on Thursday night. Choudhary allegedly harassed Ravinath to give way through his hermitage to a piece of land where the MLA wanted to build a resort.

356.title: Didn't get into it for murky, dirty politics we're seeing today: Aaditya
356.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that he did not get into politics for "murky, dirty politics of treachery" that is seen today. While sharing a picture on his Instagram Stories, he wrote, "The coastal road work visit reminded me...that this is why I got into politics: sustainable development...Let them indulge in it, we will stand to serve the people."

357.title: Russia imposes entry bans on 62 Canadians in tit-for-tat move
357.article_body: Russia on Friday said it was imposing entry bans on 62 Canadian citizens including government officials. The list includes figures known for "their malicious activity in the fight against the 'Russian world' and our traditional values", the Russian Foreign Ministry said. Moscow said the bans came in retaliation for Canada's sanctions against Russian citizens in June and July.

358.title: Kohli's 57 in T20 WC 2021 loss vs Pakistan was 'impactless': Hafeez
358.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez said Virat Kohli's 57 off 49 balls in India's defeat against Pakistan by 10 wickets in T20 World Cup 2021 was "impactless". "If you can't bring an impact, there is no point of you playing," added Hafeez. "In the past two-three years, we saw...the impact wasn't there," he stated. Kohli had a strike rate of 116.32.

359.title: 1-yr-old dies as uncle takes him in lap, drops him to ground in J'khand
359.article_body: A one-year-old boy died after his paternal aunt's husband took him into his lap for playing with him but dropped him to ground with force, reports said. The boy was severely injured and was rushed to hospital but he succumbed to his injuries on Friday morning, reports added. Incident came to light when family members reached spot upon hearing screams.

360.title: Twitter fixes security bug that exposed data of anonymous account owners
360.article_body: Twitter informed that it has fixed a security vulnerability that exposed an undetermined number of owners of anonymous accounts to potential identity compromise last year. This comes after a report alleged that data of 5.4 million Twitter users were put on sale on a hacker forum. It added, while the number of users affected isn't known, no passwords were exposed.

361.title: 30-yr-old Indian-origin woman dies by suicide after 8 years of domestic abuse in US
361.article_body: A 30-year-old Indian-origin woman Mandeep Kaur, a resident of New York, died by suicide on 3 August, after repeated domestic abuse allegedly by her husband Ranjodhbeer Singh Sandhu for close to eight years. In a video, Kaur showed her bruises and blood clots and revealed how her in-laws encouraged the abuse. "I was beaten up every day," she said.

362.title: I won't be invited to his party: Kareena on ex-boyfriend Shahid Kapoor
362.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7' alongside actor Aamir Khan, said she wouldn't be invited to a party of her ex-boyfriend Shahid Kapoor. Karan Johar termed Shahid as Kareena's "ex-husband" by mistake during the episode before correcting himself. Discussing his break-up with Kareena, Shahid had earlier stated, "It was a very trying period."

363.title: 3 more die of Japanese Encephalitis in Assam, death toll reaches 60
363.article_body: After three more people died due to Japanese Encephalitis in Assam on Friday, the death toll from the disease since July 1 has reached 60, according to the state's National Health Mission. The total number of cases of the virus also rose to 345 after six more cases were reported in the state. The disease spreads through mosquito bites.

364.title: UP, Deloitte India sign MoU to meet state's $1 trillion economy target
364.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday appointed Deloitte India as a consultant to meet the target of lifting the state's economy to $1 trillion. A Memorandum of Understanding with Deloitte India was signed in Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's presence in Lucknow. By 2027, Uttar Pradesh will become a benchmark for the policy of "Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas", the CM said.

365.title: Ranveer has idiosyncrasies but translates beautifully on celluloid: Karan
365.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar on Friday penned a note for Ranveer Singh on Instagram. He wrote, "I have grown to love Ranveer Singh...He has his idiosyncrasies as an artist but [that's] what we see translate so beautifully on celluloid!" Karan further wrote, "I have been so touched on so many instances just by his generosity of spirit! I love you Ranveer!"

366.title: Our humanness is not accepted sometimes: Willow on dad Will slapping Chris
366.article_body: Speaking about her father Will Smith slapping comedian Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, singer Willow Smith said that she sees her whole family as being human. Willow further said, "Because of the position that we're in, our humanness sometimes isn't accepted and we're expected to act in a way that isn't conducive to a healthy human life and...being honest."

367.title: 50 fall ill after eating midday meal at Bihar school, students say lizard fell into it
367.article_body: Around 50 students fell ill after eating a midday meal at a government school in Bihar's Bhagalpur on Friday, an official said. The students claimed that the school's administration had served them the food even though a lizard had fallen into the vegetables while it was being cooked. Students were admitted to the primary health centre, Jagdishpur BDO said.

368.title: Uddhav was ready to align with BJP if rebels dumped Shinde: Maha MLA
368.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray was ready to align with BJP in the state if the rebel MLAs had dumped Eknath Shinde, MLA Deepak Kesarkar claimed. "This was not acceptable to the BJP or the MLAs. Because it would have been inappropriate. The rest is history," Kesarkar, who is the spokesperson of the Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction, added.

369.title: Leopard electrocuted by poachers in Madhya Pradesh, 2 detained
369.article_body: A leopard was electrocuted after it came in contact with a live-wire trap allegedly set up by poachers in Madhya Pradesh. The animal was found dead in the Beohari forest range on Friday, Divisional Forest Officer (North) Gaurav Choudhary said. "We've detained two persons in this connection," Choudhary said, adding that the animal could have been around seven years old.

370.title: Showing innocence from 20s to late 40s was very difficult: Aamir on 'Laal...'
370.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said it was "very difficult" to portray the innocence of his character in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' being 57 years old, with the character's journey from his 20s to late 40s shown in the film. Aamir added he's concerned about the film's performance, with audiences less forgiving. "Unfortunately, I have to go through this every time," he stated.

371.title: Man steals water taps, shower heads, doors from PU girls' hostel, held
371.article_body: Chandigarh Police have arrested a man for allegedly stealing hundreds of water taps, shower heads, aluminium windows and doors, reportedly estimated to be worth lakhs, from Panjab University's Girls' Hostel Number 11, last month. Three others who were involved with the arrested man have been identified and will be arrested shortly, investigators said.

372.title: K'taka govt clears investments worth ₹34,432 cr, to generate 48,850 jobs
372.article_body: Basavaraj Bommai-led Karnataka government cleared investments worth ₹34,432 crore and will create 48,850 jobs. As many as eight new projects and 10 additional investment projects were approved which are expected to generate employment opportunities, as per an official statement. Of the projects cleared, TruAlt Energy Solutions has proposed to put up an ethanol plant worth ₹1,856.47 crore.

373.title: India reports 19,406 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,34,793
373.article_body: India has reported 19,406 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,551 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,34,793, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,649, according to the latest data.

374.title: 12-yr-old Haryana boy creates 3 apps, sets Guinness record for youngest app developer
374.article_body: A 12-year-old Class 8 boy from Haryana's Jhajjar has developed three learning applications with the help of YouTube and created a Guinness World Record by becoming the youngest app developer in the world. Kartikeya Jakhar also bagged a scholarship after qualifying for the entrance exam of Harvard University. Jakhar's father had bought him a ₹10,000 phone for his online classes.

375.title: 'We could shutdown WazirX,' says Binance CEO; WazirX Co-founder replies
375.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said "we could shutdown WazirX" after he denied owning a stake in the Indian cryptocurrency exchange. Zhao, however, said they can't do that because it will hurt WazirX users. Responding to this, WazirX Co-founder Nischal Shetty said, "[This] proves you have control." Shetty reassured users that all their crypto and INR assets on WazirX are safe.

376.title: Official leading Taiwan's missile production found dead amid tensions with China
376.article_body: Amid tensions with China, an official leading the Taiwan's missile production was found dead in a hotel room, according to the official Central News Agency. Ou Yang Li-hsing was serving as deputy head of military-owned National Chung-Shan Institute of Science and Technology. The institute is working to more than double its yearly missile production capacity to around 500 this year.

377.title: IAF chief flies combat aircraft in Bengaluru
377.article_body: Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari flew indigenous Light Combat Aircraft Mk 1 'Tejas', Light Combat Helicopter and HTT-40 during his visit to Bengaluru. He was reviewing the aircraft that are being inducted into the IAF. "The Air Chief Marshal also interacted with the test crew and designers to understand the current status and future plans," IAF tweeted.

378.title: Got fooled at this age, never thought Harnaaz would do this: Upasana
378.article_body: Actress-producer Upasana Singh, who is suing Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Sandhu for breaching contract, said that she could never imagine Harnaaz would do that to her. "In this age also I got fooled by her," she added. Upasana said that Harnaaz has been avoiding her calls and friend circle, adding that she is considering a Punjabi film a small thing.

379.title: Kerala officials rescue 3 pregnant women amid heavy rainfall
379.article_body: Amid heavy rainfall in Kerala, three pregnant women who were stranded in a forest were rescued by officials and shifted to a safer place. One out of the three women gave birth to a baby girl in the forest after she refused to go to the hospital. Health Minister Veena George congratulated the rescue team for saving the women.

380.title: Cab driver plays mobile game while driving, man posts video; tags Hyd police
380.article_body: A Twitter user took to the micro-blogging site to share a video of a cab driver who was seen playing a mobile game while driving the car. "driving without seat belt and most unique way driving while playing in mobile phone...Full time he was playing," the user wrote. The man also tagged Hyderabad Police in his tweet.

381.title: Jail term certain for Sonia, Rahul in National Herald case: Swamy
381.article_body: BJP leader Subramanian Swamy said that a jail term is certain for Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and others in the National Herald case. "If BJP stays in power, they will surely be imprisoned. But in case Congress comes into power, nothing can be said," he added. Sonia and Rahul were questioned by Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with the case.

382.title: CBI summons TMC leader Anubrata in cattle smuggling case
382.article_body: The CBI on Friday summoned TMC's Birbhum district chief Anubrata Mondal in connection with the cattle smuggling case. He has been asked to appear before the investigators at 11 am on Monday. His security personnel Saigal Hussain has also been arrested by the agency. During the probe, the CBI has found huge property in the name of Hussain.

383.title: Pune man cheats investor of ₹4 cr by promising 24% returns; booked
383.article_body: Pune's Sinhgad police have booked a man for allegedly cheating an investor of over ₹4 crore by promising him 24% returns on the pretext of investing the money. The accused had floated a company which handled forex trading, share trading and construction, according to the FIR. The case was filed under IPC Section 420 (cheating) and the Information Technology Act.

384.title: Unclog jails to mark 75 years of India's Independence: SC to Centre
384.article_body: Unclogging prisons and trial courts could be a perfect way of celebrating 75 years of India's independence, Supreme Court told the central government on Friday. It urged the Centre to work with states and Union Territories to come up with measures where certain categories of undertrials and convicts could be released. "You must think out of the box," SC said.

385.title: Pelosi is the worst destroyer of international peace: North Korea
385.article_body: North Korea said US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is "the worst destroyer of international peace and stability", accusing her of inciting anti-North Korea sentiment while visiting South Korea and enraging China during her Taiwan visit this week. "It would be a fatal mistake for her to think that she can go scot-free in the Korean Peninsula," North Korea added.

386.title: 1st Muslim woman in North Kerala to get English education dies at 95
386.article_body: Maliyekkal Mariyumma, first Muslim woman in North Kerala to get English education, passed away aged 95 on Friday in Kannur district. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan expressed grief over her death. "We have lost a person who had left her indelible footprints along with the history of Thalassery....Her death plunges a generation and a region into grief," the Chief Minister said.

387.title: No sympathy for madrasas' bad elements, govt should shoot them: AIUDF chief
387.article_body: The All India United Democratic Front chief Maulana Badruddin Ajmal said that the party has no sympathy for the "bad elements" in madrasas. "Government should shoot them wherever they find them. If one or two bad teachers are found at madrasas, the government should impose detentions and pick them up once inquiry completes and do whatever they want," he added.

388.title: Man arrested for illegal possession of firearm, bullets in Hyderabad
388.article_body: The Hyderabad police on Friday arrested a 43-year-old man for illegally possessing a country-made firearm. Police also recovered eight live rounds from the accused, identified as Rakesh Tyagi. According to police, Tyagi works at a private diagnostic centre and is a native of Madhya Pradesh. He was arrested while trying to sell the firearm to prospective buyers, police added.

389.title: Actress Anne Heche critical after crashing car into house in Los Angeles
389.article_body: American actress Anne Heche is critical after crashing her car into a house in Los Angeles. The impact left the car and the house engulfed in flames, police said. "Fifty-nine firefighters took 65 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish the stubborn flames within the heavily damaged structure," Los Angeles Fire Department said.

390.title: Sick mind: Jairam on Shah linking Congress' protest to Ram Mandir
390.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Friday reacted to Union Home Minister Amit Shah linking the party's protest to Ram Mandir's foundation day, saying, "It's only a sick mind which can produce such bogus arguments." Shah had claimed that Congress choosing to protest wearing black clothes on anniversary of Ram Mandir's foundation day was a "subtle message to...promote their appeasement politics".

391.title: I was drug tested by US govt for a year: Musk on smoking weed with Joe Rogan
391.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in a podcast interview said he was drug tested by the US government after he smoked weed on Joe Rogan's podcast in 2018. "The consequences for me and for SpaceX were actually not good...I had...to prove that I'm not...a drug addict," Musk said. He added that he was randomly drug tested for everything for a year.

392.title: Hat-trick at CWG proves Bajrang has champion's consistency: Anurag Thakur
392.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted that wrestler Bajrang Punia has shown he has a "champion's consistency" after winning a third consecutive medal at CWG. Bajrang won his second consecutive gold medal at CWG, after beating Canada's Lachlan McNeil in the final of the men's freestyle 65 kg category at CWG 2022. Bajrang had won a silver medal at CWG 2014.

393.title: 27 get life sentence in 2018 Dalit triple murder case in Tamil Nadu's Kachanatham
393.article_body: A court on Friday sentenced 27 persons to life imprisonment in the 2018 triple murder of Dalit men in Kachanatham village in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga. The victims were hacked to death in a feud related to paying respects at a temple festival. Notably, five more Dalit people had sustained injuries, of which one died one and half years later.

394.title: Greek intelligence chief resigns amid wiretapping allegations
394.article_body: The head of Greece's intelligence service has resigned amid allegations that a journalist and an opposition politician had their mobile phones targeted by spying software. Panagiotis Kontoleon submitted his resignation "following mistaken actions found during lawful wiretapping procedures", PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis' office said. Secretary-General of the PM's office, Grigoris Dimitriadis, also quit.

395.title: Wasn't bothered even when 0-4 down in final: Sakshi after CWG gold medal
395.article_body: Wrestler Sakshi Malik said she wasn't bothered when 0-4 down in the women's freestyle 62 kg final against Canada's Ana Godinez at CWG 2022. Sakshi made a comeback to win her first CWG gold medal. "I'd won bouts with seconds left," added Sakshi. Discussing her double leg move in the final, Sakshi stated, "I can do [it] in my sleep."

396.title: I was clean-shaven in 2 films, both films were shaved too: Anil Kapoor
396.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor recently appeared on the OTT show 'Case Toh Banta Hai'. He was asked by actor Ritesh Deshmukh why he didn't keep his moustache after 1991 film 'Lamhe'. Anil said, "Do film mein mooche safa ki thi, unfortunately film bhi safa ho gayi yaar (I was clean-shaven in two films, unfortunately both films got shaved off too)."

397.title: Voting to elect the Vice-President of India begins
397.article_body: The voting for the Vice-Presidential election began on Saturday. For the 16th Vice-Presidential election, the Electoral College consists of 233 elected members of Rajya Sabha, 12 nominated members of Rajya Sabha, and 543 elected members of Lok Sabha. NDA has nominated Jagdeep Dhankhar as their candidate, while the Opposition fielded Margaret Alva as their candidate for the post.

398.title: China simulating attack on our main island: Taiwan
398.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry has said that multiple batches of Chinese planes and ships were spotted crossing median line of Taiwan Strait. "They were judged to be conducting a simulation of an attack on Taiwan's main island," the ministry added. This comes amid heightened tensions between China and Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan.

399.title: Paytm Q1 net loss widens to ₹644 crore, revenue jumps 89%
399.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications on Friday said that its consolidated loss widened to ₹644.4 crore in the quarter ended June 30 as against a net loss of ₹380.2 crore in the corresponding period last year. Its consolidated revenue from operations increased 89% to ₹1,680 crore year-on-year from ₹891 crore. Paytm's shares closed 3.06% lower at ₹784.30 on Friday.

400.title: Instead of GDP, govt bothered about DP: TMC MP Mahua Moitra
400.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Friday said the central government has an "uncanny knack" of ignoring what's important and concentrating on headlines. "For example...when we should be looking at...GDP (Gross Domestic Product), we're being exhorted...to concentrate on our DPs (display pictures)," she added. This comes after PM Modi urged people to put Tricolour as their display picture on social media.

401.title: Nykaa Q1 profit rises by 42% to ₹5 crore, revenue jumps 41%
401.article_body: Nykaa parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures on Friday posted a 42.24% rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹5.01 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹3.52 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue from operations grew 40.56% to ₹1,148.4 crore year-on-year. Nykaa's shares on Friday closed at ₹1,411.25 after dropping 2.30%.
